description: American Express Publishing is bringing in Marianne Howatson to be publisher of Travel & Leisure magazine and is promoting James S. Berrien to publisher of Food & Wine, Thomas O. Ryder, president, announced last week.

title: U.S. AND SOVIET REPORTED TO AGREE TO SHCHARANSKY'S RELEASE TO WEST
description: Reagan Administration officials said today that American and Soviet negotiators had reached agreement on a prisoner exchange that would include the release of the Soviet dissident Anatoly B. Shcharansky to the West.

title: Southern Yemen Seeks Return of Soviet Aides
description: Southern Yemen urged the Soviet Union today to let its engineers and advisers return here to work on joint economic projects that were halted last week by fighting between rival Moslem factions, the Aden radio reported.

title: BEERY AUSTRALIA ISN'T READY FOR THE WATER WAGON
description: In this balmy city sprawled above a sunlit harbor, lights rarely burn late in the high-rise offices, and drivers scrupulously avoid gridlock, politely enduring dense traffic jams.

title: SYRACUSE LEADS A CLOSE LEAGUE RACE
description: As the Big East passes the midway point of its season, a flurry of upsets and some convincing performances by front-runners have paved the way for one of the most exciting races in the league's seven-year existence.

title: NEW YORK HONORS THE CHALLENGER'S 7
description: Seven cannon rounds, one for each of the Challenger astronauts, were fired into the overcast above Central Park yesterday at a memorial service for the victims of the space shuttle explosion. About 500 people, some on skateboards and bicycles, watched solemnly.

title: Koch Terms Scandal 'Worst Since Lindsay'
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that the scandal confronting his administration was ''the worst since John Lindsay.''

title: Lendl Wins Final; Mayotte Defaults
description: Ivan Lendl won the 25th annual United States Pro Tennis Tournament today when Tim Mayotte defaulted because of an injury.

title: INVESTIGATORS EXAMINE DATA FOR POSSIBLE BOOSTER FLAMES
description: Faulty seams, flawed casings and poorly packed fuel are among the flaws that could explain a rupture in a solid-fuel booster rocket on the space shuttle Challenger, which is viewed by many as the cause of the explosion Tuesday that destroyed the Challenger.

title: Arts and Letters Group Elects 8 New Members
description: Eight new members have been elected to the 250-member American Academy and Institute of Arts and Letters, the honorary organization of artists, authors and musicians.

title: Election in Philippines Gets Educator's Priority
description: When David J. Steinberg took over as president of Long Island University last June, he vowed he would not give up teaching because, he said, he wanted to keep in touch with the students on a ''nonconfrontational basis'' and to remind himself that the ''central purpose of the institution is teaching.''

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Banc One Corp., Columbus, Ohio, has elected to its board Rene C. McPherson, retired chairman of the Dana Corp., and John W. Kessler, owner of the John W. Kessler Co.

title: Holbert Daytona Winner
description: The Porsche 962 driven by Al Holbert, Derek Bell and Al Unser Jr. made up a six-lap deficit late in the race and went on to a hard-earned victory today in the Sunbank Daytona 24 Hours.

title: PLAN TO BURN COAL WASTES SPURS PENNYSYLVANIA HOPES
description: The naked, poisonous mountain that has come to be called ''the Volcano'' by people living in its shadow here has stood for nearly half a century as a symbol of the destruction that coal mining has wrought in this region.

title: FLORENCE E. DOYLE, EX-BROKER ON NEW YORK EXCHANGE, 94
description: Florence Elliot Doyle, one of the first women to become a broker on the New York Stock Exchange, died of heart failure Friday at St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center. She was 94 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: CONGRESS AS 'A FRIEND' TO VOTERS IN PHILLIPINES
description: When Filipinos vote in presidential elections Friday, they will do so under an unusual degree of scrutiny from the United States Congress, reflecting its growing concern with the political processes of friendly developing countries.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: SOLDIERS IN HIDING. By Richard Wiley. 199 pages. Atlantic Monthly Press. $14.95. ''IT gives me pleasure to hinder American tourists occasionally. It is a small pleasure, to be sure, but a real one, and it is so very un-Japanese.'' So goes the opening of Richard Wiley's ''Soldiers in Hiding,'' and its mischievousness seems reason enough to go on reading this unusual first novel.

title: CELTICS' STREAK HITS 11
description: Scott Wedman and Dennis Johnson sparked a decisive third-period rally today as the Boston Celtics overcame a 21-point deficit for a 114-101 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics.

title: U.S. APPEALS COURT RULES POLICY BY POLICE TO AVOID SUIT IS ILLEGAL
description: A Federal appeals court in Boston has struck down a procedure used by law-enforcement agencies around the country to protect themselves against being sued for false arrests.

title: RED CROSS'S HOTEL CARES FOR HOMELESS FOR LESS
description: Nearly a year ago the American Red Cross took the unusual step of signing a three-year lease on the Travel Inn, a tourist hotel on a ragged block of West 41st Street near 11th Avenue.

title: Normalizing Relations With Vietnam
description: Although 10 years have passed since the end of the Vietnam War, America still refuses to establish normal diplomatic relations with Vietnam. The unresolved issues, from our viewpoint, are the 100,000 Vietnamese troops in Cambodia and 2,000 American troops missing in action. The Vietnamese say that normalization is in their interest and ours, and insist that eventually they will remove their troops from Cambodia and account for the missing troops. Normalization would help resolve both issues. Failure to normalize will only drive Vietnam further into the Soviet sphere.

title: Freedom and Feminism at the PEN Congress
description: To the Editor:

title: Peru Will Roll Over Bank Debt
description: Peru's Government today unilaterally declared that it would roll over unpaid debt to foreign private banks for three more months, and set a ceiling on interest rates it would pay on the loans.

title: Write-Off for Indiana Utility
description: The Public Service Company of Indiana may have to take as much as a $1 billion write-off as part of a settlement aimed at helping the utility recover from the costly cancellation of the Marble Hill nuclear power plant, analysts say.

title: BOTHA WOOS SOUTH AFRICA'S BLACKS WITH AN ADVERTISEMENT
description: President P. W. Botha of South Africa, seeking to change his image among blacks, placed two-page advertisements in newspapers today, committing himself to sharing power and declaring, ''From my heart, I ask you to share in the future.''

title: Advertising; B.B.D.O. Resigns Rest Of Black & Decker Job
description: Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborne, which lost part of the Black & Decker business to McCann-Erickson early last week, celebrated Friday by resigning the remainder - not exactly a hollow move, since the remainder would have billed $5 million this year.

title: EVEN RIO'S MONEY FEELS CARNIVAL BEAT
description: This city's spectacular pre-Lenten carnival, according to the samba lyrics that accompany it, is the time when the poor spend a year's savings on lavish costumes and dance feverishly until they forget they are poor.

title: CONNECTICUT CANDIDATES BRACING FOR LOCAL TESTS
description: With the speeches and rallies announcing their candidacies now concluded, the contenders for governor of Connecticut this year are turning to a new and more arcane phase of their campaigns.

title: PENTAGON SEES RESEARCH PERIL IN BUDGET CUTS
description: Budget cuts mandated by Congress and the determination of President Reagan to protect his space defense program threaten to seriously disrupt other military research projects, ranging from underground nuclear weapons testing to artificial intelligence, Pentagon officials say.

title: PATIENT GETTING ARTIFICIAL HEART
description: A team of surgeons at Presbyterian-University Hospital tonight were implanting a Jarvik-7 artificial heart into a 39-year-old man from western Pennsylvania.

title: MUSIC: A DAY OF SONG AT LINCOLN CENTER BRINGS FOUR DIVAS IN THREE ACTS
description: ''COME, ALL YE SONGSTERS,'' sang Kathleen Battle at a few minutes past 3 P.M. yesterday from the stage of Alice Tully Hall; by then it was a superfluous invitation. Four of the world's most sought-after songstresses were already assembled for Lincoln Center's unofficial Diva Day, in which Miss Battle was followed by Jessye Norman at the Metropolitan Opera with James Levine at the piano, and then by Montserrat Caballe and Marilyn Horne at Avery Fisher Hall with full orchestra and - like the others - a full house. The orgy of vocalism was celebrated for close to eight hours with little interruption. Everybody was there.

title: DO MORE FOR HOMELESS, SAY HALF OF THOSES POLLED
description: About half of all adult Americans think local governments are not demonstrating enough concern for the homeless, a New York Times/CBS News Poll shows, and that feeling is especially strong among people who say they see the homeless personally and do not just know of them through television or newspapers.

title: Vietnam Memorial Will Add Names of 96 More Veterans
description: The names of 96 more combat veterans will be inscribed on the walls of the Vietnam Memorial by Memorial Day, Jan C. Scruggs, founder of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial Fund, announced today.

title: BRINGING THE N.B.A. SHOOTOUT TO DALLAS
description: SOMEWHERE among his most valued possessions, perhaps no less important than his marriage license or the title to his house, is a manual for success authored by Norm Sonju, the general manager of the Dallas Mavericks. This is no ordinary how-to booklet; within its pages are documented steps to shaping and sustaining a viable professional basketball franchise.

title: GRETZKY ON ICE: AMAZING GREAT
description: AS he remembers it, he did not know where the puck had come from. Or if he did, he did not know exactly how it had gotten there. But there it was, resting on the blade of his stick, and since Doug Wilson is one who knows what to do with a gift, he hesitated no more. He shot and he scored and then he wondered, how did his teammate do that?

title: A WARNING BY SAUDIS ON OUTPUT
description: Saudi Arabia warned the members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries today that it would ''not retreat'' from a strategy of forcing non-OPEC countries to reduce their share of world oil production to shore up tumbling oil prices, according to a published report.

title: Article 192686 -- No Title
description: The Howard Hughes Medical Institute is announcing plans today to spend at least $1 billion for biomedical research over the next five years.

title: MONDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Knicks vs. Kings, at Sacramento. Patrick Ewing, the Knicks' rookie center, got a rare opportunity to rest in the fourth quarter after contributing 24 points to the Knicks' 115-97 victory over the Kings at the Garden Jan. 13.

title: Advertising; Promoting New York As a College Town
description: New York City happens to be a college town to end all college towns. There are 88 of them in the five boroughs.

title: Rift in the Bronx G.O.P.
description: The Bronx Republican organization has been described as small enough to meet in a telephone booth. But whatever its size, it is divided.

title: REEBOK INTERNATIONAL LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CONSOLIDATED FIBRES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income. Year-ago amounts have been restated to include the results of Plastofilm Industries Incorporation, which was purchased in July 1985.

title: 'THE MARSH,' NATURE SERIES ON 13
description: THE best way for a city type, who may resist visiting anything past the last subway stop, to see nature in its pristine glory is on television, where you can take off your shoes and not be bitten by mosquitoes or have to deal with slimy creatures outside of our own species. This is done, with considerable beauty, on ''Profiles of Nature,'' the Channel 13 series that, starting tonight at 7 o'clock, looks in on ''The Marsh.''

title: PHELPS DODGE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After tax credits of $2,800,000 for the quarter and $10,600,000 for the year. c-Net loss, which reflects losses from the operations of an energy segment of $100,000 for the quarter and $24,500,000 for the year, and losses on the disposition of the energy segment of $85,000,000 for the quarter and the year. Year-ago results reflect non-recurring pre-tax charges of $110,000 from a restructuring program.

title: Paris Blast Wounds 8 In a Shopping Arcade
description: An explosion, apparently caused by a bomb, ripped through a crowded shopping arcade on the Champs-Elysees tonight. Eight people were wounded, three of them seriously.

title: TOYS PLUS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
OPEC Weighs Output Plans
description: Officials of five OPEC countries worked again today to try to reach an agreement on what daily oil-production level to propose to the full 13-member group as its fair market share.

title: The U.N. Today; Feb. 4, 1986
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Advisory Committee on Science and Technology - 10 A.M. and 3 P.M. ECONOMIC AND

title: Added Charges
description: Tony Robinson and Kenneth Cooper, the former University of Tennessee football players who already faced criminal charges after being arrested for the sale of cocaine last month, were charged with additional counts of selling cocaine to undercover narcotics agents. Robinson, whose career was cut short by a knee injury midway through the 1985 season, was charged with two additional counts, and Cooper, a reserve running back from 1981 to 1984, with four caine. The additional counts relate to what officials said were sales before their arrest, Jan. 8.

title: ENERGY PRICE DROP MARS MOUNTAIN STATES' HOPES
description: It was not long ago that people here on the Western Slope of the Rockies watched as the giant oil companies invested millions in construction and equipment used in mining and refining the country's next energy miracle, shale oil.

title: Ex-Mayor's Financier Guilty in Campaign Plot
description: A financier who is already serving a Federal prison term for defrauding investors pleaded guilty today to state charges arising from a plot to finance former Mayor Roger Hedgecock's 1983 campaign illegally.

title: A CHEAPER WAY TO BUILD TRANSISTORS
description: A NEW method for building transistors has been invented by scientists at Energy Conversion Devices, Inc. of Detroit, the company announced today at a press conference in Tokyo.

title: SHAMAN AND THE DYING SCIENTIST: A BRAZILIAN TALE
description: An evil toad poisons a good naturalist and the nation watches helplessly as he begins dying slowly. The President becomes alarmed and calls in an Indian shaman, who magically extracts the venom - and the naturalist is saved.

title: 500 ATTEND MASS FOR SPACE TEACHER
description: About 500 friends, relatives and neighbors of Christa McAuliffe gathered this morning for a funeral mass in a church where she once taught confirmation classes.

title: TROUBLES MOUNT AT 10 DOWNING ST.
description: A telltale hint of the political damage done to Margaret Thatcher by a month of sharpening controversy emerged the other day when the Prime Minister sought to remind a panel of television interviewers that unemployment was a much more important problem for the nation than the future of the small helicopter company called Westland.

title: VODAVI TECHNOLOGY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
POVERTY'S CHILDREN IN CHESTER, PA.
description: IT is not a cheerful subject but it is there - poverty in America, a poverty that causes malnutrition and diseases of the body and mind. ''Growing Up Poor,'' this week's edition of ''Frontline'' (tonight at 10 on WNET/Channel 13), delivers the story in a strong documentary style.

title: QADDAFI SAID TO URGE ARABS TO HEIGHTEN THEIR 'STRUGGLE'
description: Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi has opened a two-day conference of radical Arab groups here with a call for them to intensify their ''struggle against imperialism'' in Europe and the United States, according to a Palestinian participant.

title: JACOBS IN OFFER FOR OIL CONCERN
description: The Pioneer Corporation, an oil and gas exploration and production concern, said yesterday that it had received an unsolicited takeover bid from Irwin L. Jacobs, the Minneapolis investor who already owns 14 percent of the company. He offered to buy the rest of the stock for $23 a share in cash, or about $648.7 million.

title: SCIENTISTS TRY TO CREATE FOREST OF CLONED TREES
description: Gary Ritchie walked between the rows of thigh-high Douglas firs like a teacher softly patrolling the aisles of a kindergarten during rest period.

title: Salvador Reports 12 Rebels Slain
description: Government soldiers reported today that they had killed 12 guerrillas and wounded 6 in widely scattered skirmishes, and the rebels increased attacks on vehicles defying their traffic ban.

title: SIZE LESS A GAUGE OF BANKS' SUCCESS
description: For the second consecutive year, many of the nation's largest banks have reported no growth or have shown only meager increases in assets. The trend, according to banking experts, is clear: Running a highly profitable bank is what bankers are striving for most, and size alone is no longer a measure of success.

title: LABARGE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes an extraordinary credit of $1,214,000 from termination of an employee pension plan. c-Reflects losses from discontinued operations of $3,539,561 for the quarter and $10,767,873 for the six months.

title: LEADERS OF INQUIRY INTO THE EXPLOSION
description: Neil A. Armstrong's appointment yesterday as vice chairman of the President's inquiry into the space shuttle disaster thrust him back into the spotlight 16 years after his walk on the moon. Since that walk he has largely avoided the limelight.

title: WORKERS AT CAPE WAIT AND WONDER
description: In offices, cafeterias and the big shuttle hangar here, workers at the Kennedy Space Center paused this afternoon to see President Reagan announce on closed-circuit television the formation of a blue-ribbon investigation commission and to hear his words of encouragement about the shuttle program's future.

title: PRIMARK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Reflects a credit to customer bills of $9,600,000 for the quarter and $10,900,000 for the year. Per share figures reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid in November.

title: TODD SHIPYARDS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: HUGE BOMB BLAST KILLS 10 IN BEIRUT
description: A huge bomb exploded in a Christian suburb here today, killing 10 people, wounding 21 others and causing devastation in a half-mile radius, the police reported.

title: Topics; Fitting the Crime, and the Kids Justice Cheated
description: A sentence of five years in prison and a fine of $209,000 might ordinarily seem sufficient for a 67-year-old first offender. But for William C. Brennan, a former New York State Supreme Court judge who sold his office, it's not much more than a slap on the wrist.

title: SUPERTEX INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
OLD SPAGHETTI WAREHOUSE reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 28
FUND MARK INSPIRES MORE CONTRIBUTIONS FOR NEEDIEST CASES
description: A record amount of contributions has inspired still more donations to the 74th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Americans in Paris At Queens Museum
description: Nine artists who were among the New Society of American Artists in Paris, a group of avant-garde painters in the early 1900's, are represented in an exhibition on view through April 6 at the Queens Museum, New York City Building, Flushing Meadows-Corona Park, Queens.

title: DIGITAL PRODUCTS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: Placement by Salomon Offers a New Wrinkle
description: Officials at Salomon Brothers are introducting a new wrinkle to the market for collateralized mortgage obligations as they are wringing the last drop of value from the pools of mortgage-backed securities that are packaged as collateral for the obligations.

title: GENERAL MOTORS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
AMERICAN FAMILY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including gains of $325,000 for the quarter and $449,000 for the year. c-Including an extraordinary gain related to tax forgiveness of $11,000,000 for the quarter and year, and capital gains of $98,000 for the quarter and $105,000 for the year.

title: DOUGLAS & LOMASON CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Includes a gain of 66 cents for the quarter and 61 cents for the year as a result of yearend inventory adjustments and insurance accruals.

title: LANE CO AND WOOD INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Per share figures reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid Jan. 31.

title: AQUINO GIVES NEW POLICY DETAILS AND LABELS MARCOS A 'PHARAOH'
description: Corazon C. Aquino, the opposition candidate, delivered a detailed policy speech today to rebut what she characterized as American concern that she might lack political substance or be ''naive'' in handling Communist insurgents.

title: Advertising; People
description: Robert C. Brandt has been promoted to executive vice president at Carrafiello, Diehl & Associates, Irvington-on-Hudson, N.Y.

title: AMOSKEAG BANK SHARES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The U.S. Military Forgets That Wars Are Won by Men
description: The Pentagon has said for years that its strength is in technology. But as a result, it has dangerously ignored the warning given 50 years ago by a young major, George S. Patton, who said, ''Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men.''

title: Market Place; K Mart Closing The Sears Gap
description: WILL the K Mart Corporation edge out Sears, Roebuck & Company before the 1980's end and become the nation's largest general merchandise retailer? The thought is hardly new. But the different growth rates of both companies in the year just ended appears to make the possibility more of a probability.

title: Education for Living In a World of Diversity
description: To the Editor:

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt Canterra Energy Ltd., a subsidiary of Canada Development Corp., is issuing 125 million Swiss francs of 5 5/8 percent, 6-year notes through Credit Suisse.

title: FORT HOWARD PAPER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Per share figures reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid last October.

title: Canadian Apologizes For 60's Eavesdropping
description: Defense Minister Erik Nielsen publicly apologized today for eavesdropping on Liberal Party caucus meetings in the mid-1960's, but dismissed his actions as nothing more than ''happenstance.''

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, a Washington dispatch yesterday about a ruling by a Federal appeals court concerning false-arrest suits misidentified the court involved. It was the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit.

title: NEW DNA TEST OFFERS BIOLOGICAL 'FINGERPRINTS' FOR CRIME FIGHT
description: A NEW biological test promises to change radically the way criminologists track down murderers, rapists and muggers.

title: FEDERAL JUDGE RULES FOR SEARS IN SEX BIAS CASE
description: A Federal district judge ruled against the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission today in a sex discrimination suit the commission filed seven years ago against Sears, Roebuck & Company, the nation's largest retailer.

title: U.S. ART SHOW OPENS IN LENINGRAD
description: Forty French Impressionist masterpieces from the National Gallery in Washington went on exhibition at the Hermitage museum today in the first major exchange of the new cultural agreement between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: CROWN CRAFTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: OIL PRICES PLUNGE AGAIN ON WORRY OVER OUTPUT
description: Concern that the troubled Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries might resort to raising its oil production caused prices to plunge again on the world market yesterday.

title: COSTA RICA GETS A PERSISTENT LEADER
description: The governing party candidate, Oscar Arias Sanchez, emerged today as the official winner of this country's presidential election.

title: FEDDERS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes income from discontinued operations of $2,990,000 for the quarter and the year and a tax loss carryfoward of $446,000 for the quarter and $2,264,000 for the year. c-Includes a tax loss carryforward of $1,124,000 for the quarter and $4,155,000 for the year.

title: Q&A
description: Q.

title: LINCOLN TELECOMMUNICAIONS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Nikhil Banerjee Dies; Sitar Virtuoso Was 55
description: Nikhil Banerjee, one of the leading sitarists of India, died of a heart attack Jan. 27 in Calcutta. He was 55 years old.

title: Macy's and Gimbels
description: Two people who ordinarily would not be invited to the same party in Washington are Albert Shanker, president of the American Federation of Teachers, and Mary Futrell, the head of the larger rival teachers union, the National Education Association. Yesterday, however, the American Enterprise Institute got the two to discuss what has loosely been called the teacher reform movement.

title: On the Road To Oxford
description: THE banker from Columbus, Ohio, was in a good mood.

title: DIAGNOSTIC RETRIEVAL SYSEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
AVEMCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a capital gain of 7 cents a share for the quarter andafter a capital loss of $269,000 for the year. c-After capital losses of 5 cents a share for the quarter and $269,000 for the year.

title: The Background; Second Handel Opera at Met
description: Handel produced ''Samson,'' which he called a ''dramatic oratorio,'' immediately after ''Messiah,'' the work that thrust him back into public favor in London after his career as a composer of Italian operas had collapsed. Although not intended as an opera, ''Samson'' has occasionally been staged as such in recent times because of its inherently operatic nature.

title: PDA ENGINEERING reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Reflects a loss $74,000 from discontinued operations.

title: AMAX INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After charges of $45 million for losses on Tungsten and base metals properties and investments, $45 million on the anticipated disposition of the company's agricultural chemicals business for the quarter and year, and including a gain of $45 million from the sale of the company's iron ore business. The year results also include a second quarter provision for losses on property and investments of $350 million. c-After a provision of $205.7 million for losses on properties and investments for the quarter and year.

title: PENTAIR INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
School Bonds For Alaska
description: Matanuska-Susitna Borough, Alaska, is offering $61.2 million of general obligation school construction bonds through underwriters led by the Foster & Marshall division of Shearson Lehman Brothers.

title: Oil Spill Injures Sea Birds Off Northern California
description: Volunteers cleaned and treated hundreds of sea birds coated with oil today, while the Coast Guard reported little success in tracing the source of the three slicks off northern California.

title: COMPAQ COMPUTER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
James Dean TV Shows In Museum Exhibition
description: Commemorating what would have been James Dean's 55th birthday, the Museum of Broadcasting, 1 East 53d Street, will open an exhibition of 25 television programs, and even a Pepsi commercial, from the actor's early career.

title: Angola Leader Orders Changes in the Cabinet
description: President Jose Eduardo Dos Santos dismissed three members of his Cabinet today and named three super-ministers who will oversee several departments of the Marxist Government, political sources said.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article on Saturday about possible causes of the destruction of the Challenger's solid-fuel booster rockets misstated the location and role of USBI Booster Production Company, formerly United Space Boosters Inc. The company, which has headquarters in Titusville, Fla., assembles the nose cone and other non-fuel-burning parts of the booster rockets.

title: Bristol-Myers In Syntex Deal
description: The Bristol-Myers Company said yesterday that it had reached an agreement with the Syntex Corporation to clear the way for Bristol-Myers to complete its proposed $294 million acquisition of the Genetic Systems Corporation, a Seattle biotechnology company.

title: LEADERS OF INQUIRY INTO THE EXPLOSION
description: William P. Rogers, who was named today as chairman of the commission investigating the space shuttle disaster, comes into the public eye again after a long period of practicing law as a senior partner in the New York City firm of Rogers & Wells. Mr. Rogers has no particular background in space technology, but he does bring to the position, according to longtime associates, an inquiring mind, instinctive good sense and an ability to delegate authority.

title: Topics; Fitting the Crime, and the Kids Sized Up
description: What does a well-dressed 1-year-old wear? Clothes that ought to be much too big, according to the size labels. Go shopping for a baby and you're likely to find garments marked ''24 months'' or ''toddler'' that will barely fit much smaller children.

title: U.S. IS SAID TO AGREE TO LET COURT DECIDE ON SHOREHAM DRILL
description: The director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency said today that the agency would not conduct a scheduled emergency evacuation drill at the Shoreham nuclear power plant if Suffolk County law continued to forbid it, according to Congressmen who met with the official.

title: Why They Disagree on New York City's Homosexual-Rights Bill
description: To the Editor:

title: Singer Acquisition
description: The Singer Company said that it had agreed to acquire the Dalmo Victor division from Textron Inc. for $174 million.

title: BRENNAN GIVEN A 5-YEAR SENTENCE AND FINED $209,000 FOR BRIBERY
description: Former Justice William C. Brennan was sentenced yesterday to five years in prison, given five more years on probation and fined $209,000 for taking bribes to fix criminal cases while serving on the State Supreme Court in Queens. He will be eligible for parole in 20 months.

title: UNITED FINANCIAL GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: KISSINGER REJECTS RACE FOR GOVERNOR
description: Henry A. Kissinger, rejecting pleas from Republican leaders, announced yesterday that he would not be a candidate for governor this year against Mario M. Cuomo for Governor of New York.

title: Texaco Files Court Brief
description: Texaco Inc. filed a brief yesterday with the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit in Manhattan arguing that the appeals court should uphold a lower court's ruling against the Pennzoil Company.

title: COMPANY LACKING PERMITS GOT CONTRACT, MEROLA SAYS
description: An armored car company operating without valid insurance or gun permits out of an office in a Bronx bingo hall was awarded a contract by the Parking Violations Bureau in 1984, investigators said yesterday.

title: SOUTHMARK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Net per share data adjusted for a 10 percent stock dividend declared in August 1985.

title: I.R.A. Bomb Kills A Soldier in Ulster
description: A soldier was killed today by an Irish Republican Army bomb while he was on patrol near the border with Ireland, the police said.

title: Loan Appeal Defended
description: The top staff official for the agency that regulates the nation's thrift institutions said today that she had sent 20 Mailgrams to local lenders seeking a large mortgage loan and identifying her position with the agency in the signature on the requests.

title: QUANTRONIX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a gain of $345,600, or 11 cents a share, from the sale of shares of Lasers for Medicine Inc. c-Includes a gain of about $208,000, or 7 cents a share, from the sale of Lasers for Medicine shares, minus a writedown of about $247,000 for uncollected receivables and inventories. d-After tax credits of $140,000. Results have been adjusted for a 3-for-2 stock split effected in the form of a dividend Dec. 23.

title: Additional Breed
description: It's a small dog, with a mop-like crest of hair (from which it derives its name) on the crown of its head, a plumed tail and tufts of hair that resemble socks on its feet. This is the Chinese crested, whose bark has been heard at 51 Madison Avenue, home of the American Kennel Club.

title: Fire at Jet Engine Plant Prompts Fear of Fumes
description: A fire burned out of control for more than five hours late Monday at a plant that makes jet engine parts, prompting the authorities to warn residents to stay indoors for fear the blaze would release toxic fumes.

title: PUBLIC SERVICE CO OF COLOADO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DUVALIER, TOURING CAPITAL BY CAR, SAYS PROTESTS WERE 'MANIPULATED'
description: President Jean-Claude Duvalier toured this capital city today in a heavily armed motorcade and told reporters the anti-Government demonstrations that have shaken Haiti over the last week were the result of Haitians being ''literally manipulated'' by ''the wrong people.''

title: Union Files Grievance
description: The Major League Baseball Players Association, as expected, filed a grievance against the owners yesterday, charging them with collusion in their treatment of free agents the last three months.

title: Why They Disagree on New York City's Homosexual-Rights Bill
description: To the Editor:

title: Bridge: A 'Law' on Pre-emptive Bids Can Be Broken to Advantage
description: There are many ''laws'' of bidding that should be treated by average players with the respect once accorded the laws of the Medes and Persians. But most of them can be breached by experts in special circumstances.

title: RESEARCHERS DRAW BACK THE CURTAIN ON THE MYSTERIOUS AURORA BOREALIS
description: Ever since human beings first settled this region they have been awed by the aurora borealis - towering, rippling, multicolored curtains of light that often hang above this city on clear, dark nights. Yet only recently have scientists been able to demonstrate the forces that control these ''northern lights.''

title: DISPLACED FARMERS' JOB PLAN IS SEEN IN DANGER FROM CUTS
description: A job training program that is helping more than 2,500 displaced farmers qualify for nonfarm jobs is threatened by a deep budget cut approved by Congress late last year, state labor officials said today.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: OLD STEPS Since 1975 the American Dancemachine has been busily preserving and performing dances that have been among the centerpieces of American musical theater, including Broadway hits and others. Although it is based in New York, the company, which tours and has been on television, has not performed in its hometown since 1978, a lapse that will be repaired with an engagement from tonight through Feb. 16 at City Center, 131 West 55th Street (246-8989).

title: ALL-STAR GAME A FESTIVAL FOR FERVANT HOCKEY FAN
description: First he saw Gretzky. Then came Coffey, and he was not quite sure, but he thought that was Bossy following, and Kerr close behind. Told that Mike Bossy had not yet arrived, the fan shrugged. He lifted his cap, pulled a pad from beneath and led the charge at the hockey all-stars, who were moving through the revolving door like the bright pastels in a kaleidoscope.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: THE HOLOCAUST. A History of the Jews of Europe during the Second World War. By Martin Gilbert. Illustrated. 959 pages. Holt, Rinehart & Winston. $24.95. MARTIN GILBERT'S new book, ''The Holocaust,'' is as straightforward an enterprise as its title suggests. The history of the Holocaust bristles with controversial issues; Mr. Gilbert himself has devoted a previous book to one such problem, the Allied reaction (or lack of reaction) to Auschwitz while it was still possible to do something about it. But on this occasion he is concerned with the broad course of events as they affected Jews throughout Nazi-occupied Europe, and with telling the story of what actually happened, rather than with why it happened or what might have happened instead.

title: THE DANCE: 'GERSHWIN' OFFERED BY CITY BALLET
description: ''GERSHWIN CONCERTO,''

title: MANES SAID TO KNOW OF INQUIRIES
description: Donald R. Manes, the Queens Borough President, has improved in health enough to be told of the allegations against him in the city's corruption scandal but is not yet well enough to respond to them, his lawyer said yesterday.

title: Latin Debtors to Meet
description: The Cartagena Group of 11 Latin American debtor countries will meet next Sunday or Monday in Washington to discuss the impact of falling oil prices, a Venezuelan Foreign Ministry spokesman said today.

title: Lyphard Line a Winner
description: Lyphard Line, a hard-knocking local colt, scored a decisive victory over a field including several promising Kentucky Derby candidates in the $67,800 Golden Grass Stakes today at Gulfstream Park. Neither Lyphard Line nor

title: MATRIX SCIENCE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a tax credit of $810,000.

title: AMERICAN SCIENCE AND ENGIEERING reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 25
description: b-After a charge of $49,000 for the quarter and a gain from a tax credit of $254,000 for the year. c-Net income. d-Net loss.

title: House Backs Warning On Smokeless Tobacco
description: The House, faced with mounting evidence that young people are turning to snuff and chewing tobacco as alternatives to cigarettes, voted today to require health warning labels on smokeless tobacco and to ban their broadcast advertising.

title: CINCINNATI FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a capital loss of $1,038,000 for the quarter and including a capital gain of $2,540,000, or 17 cents a share, for the year. c-After a capital loss of $537,000 for the quarter and including a capital gain of $1,375,000, or 9 cents a share, for the year.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond Buyer Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: CARLING O'KEEFE LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: UNFAIRNESS CHARGE AT HONDA IS DISMISSED BY LABOR BOARD
description: The National Labor Relations Board has dismissed a charge of unfair labor practices brought by the United Automobile Workers against the Honda Motors Company, an action that appears to clear the way for a union representation vote at the company's plant in Marysville, Ohio.

title: Chess: Kahlifman Wins Junior Title With a Positional Manuever
description: The 1986 European Junior Championship in Groningen, the Netherlands, was a triumph for 20-year-old Aleksandr Khalifman of the Soviet Union. Khalifman's winning 11-2 score put him two points ahead of 18-year-old James Howell of Britain.

title: How the Aides See It
description: Congressional aides may or may not be brighter than their bosses, and questions have been raised from time to time whether they are at all aware of what people outside of Washington are thinking. With those caveats, here are some opinions of high-ranking staff members who responded to questions from an organization called Fleishman-Hillard Opinion Research.

title: COLLEGE STUDENTS: LITTLE CHANGE FOUND
description: ''FIFTEEN years ago, the nation's youth was going to pot, now they are going to the bank; their idealism has been replaced by materialism; hippies have become yuppies.''

title: LAST-MINUTE SAVINGS ON TAXES
description: Over the next two and a half months, millions of Americans will engage in the annual ritual of scavenging for last-minute ways to cut their income tax bill without risking an audit.

title: Lockheed Climbs 17.4%
description: The Lockheed Corporation reported yesterday that fourth-quarter earnings rose 17.4 percent on a 7.5 percent increase in sales.

title: CONISTON AIMS TO FIT NL IN ITS INVESTMENT PLANS
description: Two investment bankers and a lawyer say they have a nose for undervalued companies ready for a shake-up.

title: NEED JOINS GREED IN SCHEMES TO SMUGGLE U.S. TECHNOLOGY
description: In March 1982 the Hughes Aircraft Company received its largest order ever from a private commercial customer. That order, for electronic testing equipment, led to the undoing of what Federal officials say is the largest network of smugglers of high technology yet uncovered in the United States.

title: GREGORY SHLOMM
description: Gregory Shlomm, founder and former chief executive of Amicale Industries Inc., a Manhattan textile company, died Thursday at the Miami Heart Institute in Miami Beach, Fla.

title: The F.B.I. Has Nothing to Hide in the Hiss Case
description: To the Editor:

description: b-Net loss. Latest quarter and year results are restated.

title: ANDOVER CONTROLS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DANCE: LUCINDA CHILDS, IN PROGRAM OF EXCERPTS
description: DANCE programs can be unified in unexpected ways. That was demonstrated on

title: FOR CHIEF JUSTICE, CONSTITUTION HAS EXTRA MEANING
description: Today Warren E. Burger the salesman put Warren E. Burger the nation's highest jurist in the shade.

title: DATA-DESIGN LABORATORIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year ago figures were restated to reflect an acquisition made in March 1985.

title: ST. JONH'S WINS
description: Perhaps the overriding question surrounding the St. John's rematch with Providence last night was not so much whether the Redmen would win or lose but how strongly they would rebound from a draining loss at Syracuse on Saturday.

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: NOW is the time to pick up the best bargains of the year on winter clothes. Just two examples: Maud Frizon shoes are going for $79 at Bergdorf Goodman, and designer sportswear has been slashed to one-third the original prices at Macy's (that's less than wholesale). And don't despair if you can't afford to do your shopping from the French haute couture. Some of the spring ready-to-wear coming into the stores this month is just as exciting.

title: Profits Scoreboard
description: See accompanying notes for special items. (Loss) * Loss in year-earlier period

title: AND NOW COMPUTERS INVADE THE THRILLERS
description: BY now we have become accustomed to entering a bookshop and seeing a large section with such titles as ''Data Encryption for Covert Corporations,'' ''The Thousand and One Delights of DOS'' and ''Hands On C for the Kindergarten Set.''

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Nets vs. Indiana Pacers, at Indianapolis, 7:30 P.M. The Nets have won three of the four meetings with the Pacers this season.

title: STEIGER TRACTOR CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Soaring Heights
description: The New York track writers offered a collective gasp yesterday afternoon when Jimmy Howard, speaking on a telephone hookup from Houston, almost nonchalantly began rattling off heights he felt capable of attaining in the high jump this year. When he stopped at 8 feet, it seemed as if Howard had finally stuck his head in the clouds.

title: Coach to Step Down
description: It might have been the loss last Thursday to Minnesota, a school that was virtually buried under a scandal involving the arrest of three players on charges of sexual assault, that finally sealed the fate of Eldon Miller, the basketball coach at Ohio State. Yesterday, in the face of widespread criticism, the 46-year-old Miller resigned. His Buckeye team was 10-9 this season and 4-5 in the Big Ten, and Miller came under increasing fire as it lost five of six games.

title: IDAHO POWER & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SURVEY FINDS 10 WILDLIFE REFUGES CONTAMINATED BY TOXIC MATERIALS
description: Ten national wildlife refuges are contaminated by toxic chemicals and another 74 may be in danger, according to a preliminary survey issued today by the Interior Department.

title: Ryan Names Aides
description: Buddy Ryan, the new head coach of the Philadelphia Eagles, named four members of his staff, among them one holdover from last year's team.

title: Seagram Unit Adds Winery
description: Sterling Vineyards, a small winery based in Calistoga, Calif., and owned by Joseph E. Seagram & Sons Inc., said today that it had agreed to buy the Winery Lake Vineyard.

title: LAWYERS-VS.-DOCTORS BATTLE ON MALPRACTICE BUILDS
description: Intensifying a dispute between the nation's lawyers and doctors, a special committee of the American Bar Association has recommended rejecting all the American Medical Association's major proposals for restrictions on malpractice suits.

title: Conglomerate Plans Buyback
description: The United Technologies Corporation said yesterday that it planned to acquire up to 10 million shares of its common stock through purchases on the open market.

title: Drop in Home-Oil Use
description: According to a report in the journal Science, the use of oil to heat homes in Western Europe and North America has sharply declined because of the effects of the oil-price increases of the 1970's and government policies to promote energy conservation. The use of oil for heating residences in seven industrial countries has fallen by 40 percent since the early 70's for a saving of about 1.2 million barrels a day, said Lee Schipper and Andrea N. Ketoff of the University of California at Berkeley.

title: CETEC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,936,000 for the quarter, $2,361,000 for the year. c-Net income including gains from discontinued operations of $15,000 for the quarter and $916,000 for the year. Results reflect the discontinuance and sale of the company's electronic distribution division completed on January 31.

title: The Genesis of the First Indian Bible
description: To the Editor:

title: STEREO VILLAGE reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Microsoft to Make Initial Stock Offer
description: The Microsoft Corporation, a leader in personal computer software, today announced its long-expected initial public stock offering.

title: HATHAWAY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CONGRESSMAN ENTERS COMA FROM NEW CANCER THERAPY
description: An Illinois Congressman has gone into a coma after complications resulting from an experimental cancer treatment at the National Cancer Institute, but the institute announced today that experiments with the new therapy would be expanded in the coming year.

title: AT ABC, THE REAPER'S SEASON ARRIVES
description: These are the worst of times, the worst of times.

title: AM CABLE TV INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 26
description: b- Net loss.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I have decided not to let my name go forward as a candidate for governor.'' - Henry A. Kissinger. [ B3:4. ]

title: FACTORY ORDERS RISE
description: United States factory orders rose in December by a sharp 2.7 percent over the November level, the biggest gain in more than a year, the Commerce Department reported today. The increase was attributed to a doubling in demand for civilian aircraft.

title: SEARCH FOR SHUTTLE DEBRIS SHIFTS TO NORTH
description: Wreckage from the space shuttle Challenger is being pushed up the East Coast by the Gulf Stream, and bits and pieces could wash ashore in the coming weeks as far north as Nova Scotia.

title: DUQUESNE LIGHT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
YONKERS MAYOR IS 'COOPERATING' IN GRAFT INQUIRY
description: A Federal grand jury is examining business dealings between the Bronx County Democratic organization and a printing company owned by the Mayor of Yonkers, officials familiar with the investigation reported yesterday.

title: KNICKS STUMBLE AGAINST LOWLY KINGS
description: Just 24 hours after the Knicks attained one of their most improbable victories of the season, it was already a distant memory.

title: WITCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
OIL DEAL CITED IN JUDGE'S TRIAL
description: A lawyer testified today that a Federal district judge on trial here had asked his help in arranging an oil deal with a wealthy businessman whose son was implicated in a drug-smuggling conspiracy.

title: A Dissenter's Outlook
description: Today, several hours before President Reagan delivers his State of the Union Message, leaders of efforts to help the homeless will offer their own version of the condition of America at a shelter near the Capitol. The visions almost certainly will be starkly different.

title: IN 30 YEARS, SPY SUSPECT PASSED HIS ONLY LIE TEST
description: Larry Wu-Tai Chin, accused of decades of spying for the Chinese, passed the only polygraph, or lie-detector, test he was given in his 30 years at the Central Intelligence Agency, prosecutors disclosed today.

title: IMPERIAL CORP OF AMERICA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income. c-Includes an extraordinary income of $6,831,000 for the quarter and $8,458 for the year.

title: MIDCON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Figures include the results of United Energy Resources, which MidCon acquired late last year.

title: CIRCLE K STORE DEAL
description: National Convenience Stores Inc. siad that it had ageed to sell 187 convenience stores to the Phoenix-based Circle K Corporation for about $41.3million in cash, plu inventories at cost.

title: Long-Term Bonds Up Sharply
description: Declining oil prices continued to bolster the bond markets yesterday, as prices of long-term Treasury issues rose nearly 7/8 of a point, despite a heavy supply of new Treasury issues to be sold this week.

title: SKATER STRUGGLES TO REGAIN FORM
description: There was a constant whirl of activity around her as other young women spun, twisted and took flight, stopping in a spray of ice, then resuming their quest for figure-skating perfection. Tiffany Chin was oblivious to the competition, her concentration riveted instead on the intricacies of her routine. The competition now is from within as Miss Chin tries to regain her championship form. When she is at her best, it really doesn't matter how crowded the ice gets during practice: She skates alone.

title: CONSOLIDATED PRODUCTS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $150,000 from early extinguishment of debt and a tax credit of $35,000. c-Net income including a tax credit of $194,000.

title: REGIS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
LOIS KELLOGG JESSUP
description: Lois Kellogg Jessup, a former dean of the Brearley School in Manhattan, died Sunday at her winter home in Newtown, Pa. She was 87 years old and also had a home in Norfolk, Conn.

title: Berry Frustrated by Defenses
description: Although the National Basketball Association replaced its so-called hardship draft with the early entry draft 10 years ago, Walter Berry may have given the old term new meaning.

title: BALDOR ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Memorable Pose With the Fellows
description: Bill Cook will never forget the occasion, but these days he just can't remember exactly where or when it happened. Cook, now 89 years old, was the captain of the first New York Ranger team and led the National Hockey League in scoring with 33 goals during the 1926-27 season, the Blues' first.

title: Advertising; Ted Bates Worldwide In Dutch Acquisition
description: Allick B.V., a Dutch ad agency, has been acquired by Ted Bates Worldwide and has been merged with the existing Ted Bates Holland to form the Allick/Bates Agency in Amsterdam, with billings of $22.8 million. Jack Allick is managing director. Bates, the second-largest American agency after Young & Rubicam, has 108 offices in 48 countries and had 1985 billings of $3.1 billion.

title: Predator Near City Hall
description: It was lunch hour. An impressively large predatory bird had perched on the third-floor ledge of the Tweed Courthouse and was slowly savoring its meal, a local pigeon.

title: INTERGRAPH CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Boat Owners Reject Binding Arbitration
description: Boat owners spurned an offer from unionized fishermen today to return to work if the two sides entered into binding arbitration.

title: Bid for Minstar Bowling Unit
description: The Minstar Corporation, the Minneapolis holding company headed by Irwin L. Jacobs, said yesterday it had received an unsolicited bid of $200 million for the bowling operations of its AMF Inc. unit. Minstar did not identify the bidder, but insiders said it was an investment group led by a retired AMF executive.

title: Kaypro Products
description: The Kaypro Corporation, a microcomputer maker that lost $18 million in the last five quarters, said it was doing away with some products in order to cut costs by steamlining ordering, production and shipping. Kaypro is also adding a hard-disk version to its popular Kaypro PC, which is compatible with the I.B.M. PC-XT. The new Kaypro PC, with 20 megabytes of storage in an internal hard disk drive, costs $1,895.

title: IN BATTLE WITH LONDON PRINTERS, MURDOCH SAYS NEWS IS GOOD
description: People who live near Rupert Murdoch's new $140 million newspaper plant in East London have been complaining about the noise. But the embattled publisher says the hum of the modern new presses is the sound of good news.

title: CROMPTON & KNOWLES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Memphis State, Bedford Rebound, 74-55
description: William Bedford had 21 points and 19 rebounds tonight to spark Memphis State to a 74-55 Metro Conference victory over Cincinnati.

title: A WEEKEND MARRIAGE OF CITY AND SUBURBIA
description: When Arnie and Marlene Zwibel got married to each other for the second time, they almost did not go through with it because they could not decide where to live. And they are still not sure. After their 1971 divorce, Arnie said goodbye to New York City. Friends call Marlene the City Mouse, and Arnie the Jersey Mouse.

title: PUBLISHING: AN EXECUTIVE SWITCH
description: Samuel S. Vaughan, the former editor in chief of Doubleday, who after 33 years with the company took early retirement effective Jan. 1, has joined Random House as senior vice president and editor of the adult trade division. He will assume his new duties March 1.

title: ONE IS KILLED AND TWO WOUNDED BY GUNMEN AT A BROOKLYN OFFICE
description: Two men fired automatic weapons through the side door of a wholesale gasoline company in Brooklyn yesterday, killing one man and wounding two others, the police said.

title: Carnegie Hall Receives A $750,000 Donation
description: The Philadelphia-based Pew Memorial Trust has given Carnegie Hall a gift of $750,000, bringing the amount raised so far in the hall's $50 million fund-raising campaign to $42 million, Carnegie Hall announced last week. The Pew grant will be used for renovation of the main hall's stage wing area, hall officials said.

title: G.M.A.C. Offer
description: The General Motors Acceptance Corporation is offering $250 million of 8 7/8 percent notes due 1991 at a price of 99.70, to yield 8.95 percent, through underwriters led by Salomon Brothers Inc. The notes, which are rated Aa-1 by Moody's and AA+ by Standard & Poor's, are priced to yield 44-hundredths of a percentage point more than Treasury securities of similar maturity.

title: JOHN PAUL FEEDS THE DYING IN CALCUTTA
description: Today, even Pope John Paul II was at a loss for words.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: A&M Food Services Inc., a restaurant franchiser in Tulsa, Okla., said its board had approved an agreement to be acquired by Pepsico Inc.

title: TAKING STOCK OF CANCER RISKS: THE LIST GOES ON
description: WE come to the midwinter doldrums, the holidays behind us, now a traditional time for wallowing in the guilt of resolutions broken, promises unfulfilled, battles lost. Among other things, it is a time when some of us take gloomy stock of the steps we should have taken to protect ourselves from cancer.

title: MORE NAVY MANEUVERS OFF LIBYA
description: Pentagon officials said today that the Navy will resume maneuvers off Libya next week and may send ships or planes into disputed waters claimed by Libya.

title: LTV Completes Sale of Steel Plant
description: The LTV Corporation said it had completed the sale of its steel plant in Gadsden, Ala., to the Brenlin Group of Akron, Ohio, ending a bid by an employee group to purchase the mill.

title: MAN TESTIFIES DEFENDANT PAID TO HAVE WIFE SLAIN
description: A Toms River insurance broker agreed to pay $65,000 to have his wife of 20 years killed, according to a Louisiana man who testified today that he had been part of the 1984 murder conspiracy.

title: SOUTH BRONX DEVELOPMENT AGENCY IS TARGET OF INVESTIGATION BY CITY
description: The City Department of Investigation said yesterday that it was studying allegations of mismanagement and conflict of interest at the South Bronx Development Organization, a city agency involved with restoration projects.

title: PENN VIRGINIA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss, which reflects a charge of $16,900,000 from the disposition of coal properties and the writeoff of assets in the fourth quarter.

title: NEWS SUMMARY: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 4, 1986
description: The Shuttle Inquiry

title: THE FRENCH COUTURE RETURNS TO SIMPLE LUXURY FOR SPRING
description: The Paris couture business, the top of the line of the world's fashion industry, is flourishing. The excitement approaches that of the couture's heyday, in the 1930's and, with time out for the war years, the 1950's and early 1960's. By the middle of the 1960's, the growing ready-to-wear business put couture in the shadow, but designers have found their way back.

title: CONSUMERS GAS UTILITY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
G.M. NET RISES 42.5% IN QUARTER
description: The General Motors Corporation today reported a 42.5 percent jump in profits in the fourth quarter. Net income rose to $1.25 billion in the period, up from $877 million a year earlier, when the company was plagued with labor disputes.

title: Cutting Close to Home
description: Because the paramount industry of Washington is government, the economic impact of mandatory Federal budget cuts under the Gramm-Rudman legislation is likely to hit home more pointedly in the capital than elsewhere.

title: REAGAN'S REMARKS ON PANEL
description: Following is a transcript of President Reagan's statement yesterday on the formation of a commission of inquiry into the Challenger disaster, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: NORTHSTAR MINERALS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
EASED LABOR CAMP CONDITIONS REPORTED IN LETTER BY SHCHARANSKY
description: Anatoly B. Shcharansky, the Jewish activist, reported in a letter from labor camp last month that he was being treated better, his brother said here today.

title: LOCKHEED CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
No Matter the Target, Prejudice Is Prejudice
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 484186 -- No Title
description: State and local governments could lose as much as $10 billion for Federal-state programs next year if the automatic cuts under the new budget-balancing law occur, three private organizations predicted today.

title: Workers Advised On Eastern Stock
description: Three unions representing Eastern Airlines employees said that they would provide financial and logistical support to their members to get a controlling interest in the stock of the airline and to bring about changes in Eastern's top management.

title: UNITED SAVINGS ASSOCIATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-The company began operations on Oct. 5, 1984, so comparable year-ago figures are not available.

title: VERDIX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net losses.

title: BUILDING OUTLAYS UP SHARPLY
description: Construction spending soared 2.8 percent in December, the sharpest increase in 11 months, the Government said today.

title: Return of Weather Devices
description: The National Weather Service has issued an appeal for return of reusable weather instruments that twice daily are lifted into the sky by balloons from about 100 stations ccoast-to-coast. They rise until, at a height of about 20 miles, outside air pressure becomes so week that the ballons burst.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 4, 1986
description: Companies

title: BIC CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a charge of $2 million relating to certain sailboard patent litigation and including a gain of $1.8 million resulting from a combination of Canadian subsidiaries. Full year 1985 results include a pretax gain of $4.3 million as a result of the devaluation of the Mexican peso which was offset by higher interest expense in Mexico. Share earnings have been adjusted for 2-for-1 stock split in the form of a 100 PC stock dividend distributed Nov. 25, 1985.

title: THE ROLE MODELS
description: One day in December, Walter Davis of the Phoenix Suns scores 43 points, a career high, and the following day comes forth and volunteers that he has a drug problem, and is sent to a rehabilitation center for six weeks.

title: SHERWIN-WILLIAMS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including $6,230,000 from year- end inventory adjustments, and provisions of $4,084,000 for the disposition of certain operations. c-Including inventory adjustments of $6,482,000.

title: FALLS CITY INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Comings and Goings
description: Paul (Bear) Bryant, whose coaching career spanned nearly four decades and 326 victories, was a unanimous selection for the National Football Foundation's College Hall of Fame. . . . Don Gullett, 35, a former pitcher for the Yankees and Cincinnati Reds, was listed in serious condition at a Portsmouth, Ohio, hospital, where he was undergoing tests to determine whether he had suffered a heart attack.

title: STEAM SYSTEM MAY IMPROVE POWER PLANTS
description: A revolutionary design for generating electricity from steam has been developed, and some independent experts think it could make the conventional, century-old system obsolete.

title: CRACKS IN 747'S SPUR U.S. ORDER FOR INSPECTIONS
description: The Federal Aviation Administration, concerned about possible severe cracks in the frame of older Boeing 747's, has ordered airlines to conduct close inspections of the fuselages of up to 160 of the jumbo jets, officials said today.

title: MCFADDIN VENTURES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 1
U.S. SEEKS TIGHTER CONTROL OF DOCTORS
description: A new Government study concludes that ''strikingly few'' doctors whose ''clinical competence is in doubt'' are prevented from practicing and that substantial changes are needed in the nation's system of disciplining unqualified or incompetent doctors.

title: PROBLEMS WITH SERVICING SHUTTLES REPORTED IN PAST SEVERAL MONTHS
description: A pattern of accidents, personnel problems and low performance ratings has marked the servicing and maintenance of the space shuttles for several months, according to Government documents and former service-contractor employees.

title: SENATORS SQUINT INTO A FUTURE UNDER TV'S GAZE
description: Is the United States Senate ready for prime time?

title: Advertising; A Citicorp Account To Smith
description: SMITH/GREENLAND, facing a field of nine competitors, has emerged victorious to become agency for the worldwide operation of the Citicorp Investment Bank. The ''multimillion-dollar'' assignment was formerly with Homer & Durham, which was in the competition and which remains agency for another Citicorp assignment.

title: JEC LASERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a tax credit of $14,700 for the quarter and $12,000 for the year.

title: A Morality Test for South Africa's Opposition
description: To earn popular support in America, third world resistance leaders must pass a kind of test. They must offer some reasonable prospect that their triumph will lead to a humane, democratic regime - and not a greater despotism. As they plead for greater support from the West in the form of sanctions, the leaders of the South African opposition now face precisely that challenge.

title: Mets Invite 10 More
description: The Mets said yesterday that 10 nonroster players had been invited to spring training along with 37 players already carried on the major league roster.

title: U.S. IS WEIGHING 3 RESPONSES TO GORBACHEV PLAN ON ARMS
description: The Reagan Administration is considering three widely varying approaches in its deliberations over how to respond to Mikhail S. Gorbachev's proposal on Jan. 15 calling for the gradual elimination of all nuclear weapons.

title: KEY DEMOCRAT LOSES HIS POST IN QUEENS PARTY
description: The acting chairman of the Queens Democratic organization said last night that he had dismissed Richard L. Rubin, the group's longtime executive secretary, who is the focus of a Federal investigation into accusations that he received kickbacks in connection with court appointments.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL BALTIMORE (AL) - Signed Mike Young, outfielder, to a contract.

title: FIRST FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss. The per share figure for the prior year net isn't applicalbe as the company went public in Feb. 1985.

title: FRANCE EXPELS 4 RUSSIANS AND MOSCOW RETALIATES
description: The Foreign Ministry announced today that four Soviet diplomats had been expelled from France following unspecified investigations into their activities. Within hours, officials here said the Soviet Union had retaliated by ordering four French envoys to leave Moscow by the end of the week.

title: MUSIC: PHILHARMONIC
description: ONE has the impression that orchestral musicians like to play for Erich Leinsdorf, not necessarily for the best reasons. Mr. Leinsdorf, who conducted the New York Philharmonic in an all-orchestral program at Avery Fisher Hall on Saturday night, is a master of his craft as he defines it, and one senses the players' respect, their willingness to give their best professional effort. Much of the playing was handsome.

title: 13% Stake in Aloha
description: A group of investors said that it had bought about 13 percent of Aloha Inc. and ''may consider seeking control'' of the Honolulu-based regional airline. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the investment group said that it might also seek to influence Aloha's management. The three investors are Michael L. Neary, president of Dallas-based Dimension Development Company; Norman Siegal, a Fort Worth-based investor, and James R. Cruce, president of Peoples Heritage Savings and Loan Association, based in Salina, Kan.

title: USPCI INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Business and Health; Hospice Care As an Option
description: ALARM at the cost of treating AIDS, or acquired immune deficiency syndome -$147,000 per patient, according to a recent Federal study - has prompted many employers to look closely at the option of hospice care.

title: TRIO-TECH INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $45,000 in the quarter and $125,000 in the year.

title: AMERICAN TECHNICAL CERAMCS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
KNIGHT-RIDDER NEWSPAPERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FRANCE RESISTS TALK ON TERRORISM
description: France is blocking a proposal that the major industrial democracies discuss joint efforts to respond to future terrorist attacks, according to officials involved in planning a May summit meeting.

title: Jake Butcher Aide a Suicide
description: George W. Ridenour Jr., a lawyer convicted of income tax fraud in connection with the collapse of the Tennessee banking empire of Jake Butcher, killed himself hours before he was to begin serving a 20-year prison sentence Saturday, the police said.

title: The Folly of Untested Weapons
description: Early in the Pacific war against Japan, American submarines failed repeatedly to hit their targets because their torpedoes ran beneath them. In Europe, soldiers died needlessly because their bazookas lacked the explosive power to disable German tanks. In Vietnam, fire and explosion caused the loss of at least 60 percent of the 5,000 downed American aircraft. And in the 1973 Mideast war, flammable hydraulic fluid killed Israeli tankers inside American M-60 tanks.

title: PRESIDENT NAMES 12-MEMBER PANEL IN SHUTTLE INQUIRY
description: President Reagan appointed a 12-member independent commission today to take responsibility for investigating the cause of the explosion of the space shuttle Challenger.

title: No Matter the Target, Prejudice Is Prejudice
description: To the Editor:

title: No Break for Baylor
description: When the National Collegiate Athletic Association placed Baylor University's basketball team on probation for rules violations, it seemed to have no objection to the team qualifying for the Southwest Conference postseason tournament.

title: O'ROURKE SEEKING A WIDER ROLE FOR COUNTY IN LOCAL GOVERNMENT
description: The Westchester County Executive, Andrew P. O'Rourke, called today for a stronger county government role in planning and administrative functions of village, town and city governments.

title: Europe Is Recovering After Heavy Storms
description: Emergency services across Europe struggled to reopen road and rail links and restore power supplies today after severe storms in several countries over the weekend.

title: VALLEY FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Reflecting a 10 percent stock dividend payable March 20. c-Net losses.

title: CAROLINA FREIGHT CARRIERS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
AIDS TEST FOR IMMIGRANTS SOUGHT
description: The Department of Health and Human Services plans to propose regulations that would require people seeking to immigrate to the United States to be screened for exposure to the AIDS virus.

title: Make a Side Deal With Mexico
description: Like a dozen other poor countries, Mexico owes foreign banks billions that it cannot possibly repay in timely fashion. Unlike other debtors, Mexico has almost unlimited quantities of oil and a rich neighbor that remains critically dependent on foreign energy supplies. Isn't there room here for a special deal?

title: EDITORS' NOTE
description: An article in The Week in Review on Sunday reported gains made by locally produced television programming around the world, which is supp lanting many shows imported from the United States.

title: WAS THERE A QUEEN OF SHEBA? EVIDENCE MAKES HER MORE LIKELY
description: THE Queen of Sheba is described in the first Book of Kings, Chapter X, as having visited King Solomon in Jerusalem ''with camels bearing spices, and very much gold, and precious stones.'' She tested the wise king with ''hard questions,'' evidently got the right answers, and then departed as mysteriously as she had arrived.

title: Resorts in Pact on Hotel Sale
description: Resorts International confirmed yesterday that it had a preliminary agreement to sell its hotel and casino in Atlantic City to the U.S. Capital Corporation for about $300 million.

title: SOUTHEASTERN SAVINGS & LOAN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a charge of $1,335,000 related to former deposit insurance. c-Including a tax credit of $434,000.

title: FOR DINING OUT, IT'S STILL AN ALSO-RAN
description: When Warner LeRoy, the flamboyant creator of Maxwell's Plum and the Tavern on the Green in New York, opens his $9 million 850-seat restaurant along the Potomac River in Georgetown this spring, he will try to spark ''a revolution,'' as he puts it, in the dining habits of Washingtonians.

title: The Deficit Strawman
description: The best thing Congress and President Reagan could do about the Gramm-Rudman-Hollings deficit reduction plan is to repeal it. As for the deficit itself, Congress could stretch out - not necessarily reduce - the President's military buildup, while the Federal Reserve Board eases monetary policy.

title: Mayor Salutes Cuomo On 'Anti-Italian' Issue
description: Mayor Koch said here today that Governor Cuomo had been absolutely right to denounce what the Mayor called an ''anti-Italian cabal'' - people who contend that an Italian-American cannot be President.

title: Veteran in Wheelchair Killed in Hit-Run Case
description: A 75-year-old disabled veteran driving a wheelchair down U.S. 1 to his home in Key West was killed by a motorist early Saturday, and a college student who turned himself in to the Florida Highway Patrol today was charged with leaving the scene of the accident.

title: Officer Pleads Guilty To Hit-Run Cover-Up
description: One of the policemen in a patrol car that killed a pedestrian and injured another last March pleaded guilty yesterday to charges of helping cover up the hit-and-run accident.

title: Careers; Assisting Spouses in Transfers
description: AMERICAN companies are relocating more and more of their employees these days and they are finding them more reluctant to move than in the past, according to a private study and interviews with corporate officials. As a result, these companies say, they have had to add financial incentives to make moving more attractive. And, because many employees' spouses lose jobs when a move takes place, the companies find they must also help them get work.

title: FAR WEST FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CARTER HAD BUILT RECORD OF SUCCESS
description: ''Rick Carter may be the finest young head coach in the nation on any level in virtually any collegiate sport.''

title: No Headline
description: When it comes to electric power, people in the Pacific Northwest rarely agree on anything.

title: Yields Are Set On Ryland Issue
description: The Ryland Mortgage Acceptance Corporation IV is offering $119.5 million of collateralized mortgage obligations, backed by a pool of conventional whole mortgage loans.

title: OPERA: VICKERS IN HANDEL'S 'SAMSON' AT THE MET
description: WHY, you may ask, would the Metropolitan Opera, which had performed only one Handel opera in its history until last night, choose for its second work the oratorio ''Samson''? Primarily, because it is the Handel work that Jon Vickers chose to sing, and the Canadian tenor has reached that stage in his illustrious career where he can get what he wants. The production, which the Metropolitan shared with London's Covent Garden and Chicago's Lyric Opera, is a showcase for Mr. Vickers's dramatic and vocal talents, which did much to sustain the evening with the aid of Elijah Moshinsky's striking if often incomprehensible staging.

title: DOW NEARS 1,600 WITH JUMP OF 23.28
description: Slumping oil prices, lower interest rates and technical factors sent Wall Street stock prices sharply higher yesterday and put the Dow Jones industrial average within easy reach of the 1,600 level for the first time.

title: IN CITY HOUSING COURT, FOCUS IS NOW MORE ON EVICTIONS THAN ON RENTS
description: New York City's tight market for rental housing has created new and complex problems for the city's housing court, even as the court has begun to redress some of its longstanding failings, according to landlords, tenants, judges and officials.

title: How to Account for Parole
description: When a parolee commits a crime, should the victim be able to sue the parole board for releasing the prisoner to prey on the public again? When the question is put that way, the answer of an appellate court in Manhattan seems like a fitting triumph for victims of crime. The court held recently that New York law permits suing the state for damages if the victim can show that parole authorities failed to observe state law and regulations.

title: ROADWAY SERVICES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BL DISCUSSING SALE OF UNITS TO G.M.
description: BL P.L.C., the state-owned vehicle maker, is holding talks that have reached an advanced stage with the General Motors Corporation about the sale of the financially ailing company's truck and four-wheel-drive vehicle divisions, the Government said today.

title: PISTONS REGAINING SENSE OF BALANCE
description: Who are the real Detroit Pistons? Those who began the season with a 12-6 record, the best start in the history of the franchise? The Pistons who then went 4-15, a slump that almost got Coach Chuck Daly dismissed? Or the current 8-3 Pistons?

title: 6 Americans in Chile Killed in Plane Crash
description: Six American passengers and two Chilean crew members were killed today when a light plane crashed in southern Chile.

title: REAGAN'S BUDGET ASKING CUTBACKS IN HEALTH PLANS
description: President Reagan's new budget proposes substantial cutbacks in projected spending on health programs for the elderly and the poor while seeking sustained increases in military spending, according to Administration officials and budget documents.

title: TWO PATIENTS RECEIVE JARVIK ARTIFICIAL HEARTS
description: A 40-year-old factory worker was undergoing surgery today to become the second woman to receive an artificial heart, hours after a Jarvik-7 was implanted in a 39-year-old Pittsburgh, Pa., man.

title: SHULTZ IS HOPEFUL ON SOVIET RIGHTS
description: Secretary of State George P. Shultz said today that the United States would regard it as ''a positive development'' if the Soviet Union released any imprisoned dissidents and generally eased curbs on emigration.

title: Warnings in Shuttle Area
description: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration today issued repeated warnings against bottom fishing in an area where searchers have been looking for debris from the space shuttle Challenger.

title: TERADYNE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a net loss of $573,000 in the quarter due primarily to an adjustment in the income taxes associated with the sale of a company- owned facility; and a net gain of $6,436,000 in the year relating to the same transaction.

title: MARCOS CAMPAIGN SHOWS HIS POWER
description: From mass mailings by the internal revenue service to traffic arrests of his opponents' supporters, President Ferdinand E. Marcos and his backers have been displaying the full range of their Governmental powers in their campaign for his re-election.

title: TAKEOVER SPECIALIST JOINS DREXEL GROUP
description: Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc., broadening its merger and acquisition activities, announced yesterday that Martin A. Siegel, a takeover specialist at Kidder, Peabody & Company, has joined the firm as a managing director and co-head of the mergers and acquisitions group.

title: NOT A RAINY DAY FOR ZOELLER
description: In one of the more bizarre finishes to a PGA Tour tournament, Fuzzy Zoeller was declared the winner today of the $108,000 first prize in the A.T.&T. Pebble Beach National Pro-Am about an hour after thinking he had to come back and play another round on Tuesday.

title: WILLIAM J. AHERN
