description: Mayor Ernest N. Dutch Morial of New Orleans, in a speech to a meeting Jan. 23 in Washington of the United States Conference of Mayors on proposals to do away with the Federal revenue sharing program:

title: 33 FOR WASHINGTON
description: Dwayne Washington, the junior point guard who had been sacrificing scoring for playmaking this season, had a career-high 33 points and seven assists tonight as Syracuse defeated Villanova, 77-72, in the Big East game.

title: PANEL QUESTIONED SHUTTLE SCHEDULE
description: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration's safety advisory board, in a report written just before the explosion of the shuttle Challenger, said that the agency's plan to schedule 18 flights a year was ''very optimistic'' and warned that a more modest plan of 12 to 15 flights would be a ''difficult but attainable goal.''

title: F.B.I. CAPTURES A KEY FUGITIVE IN BRINK'S CASE
description: A fugitive the authorities consider the leader of the group that robbed a Brink's armored car in Rockland County in 1981, leaving two police officers and a Brink's guard dead, has been captured in Los Angeles, Federal investigators said yesterday.

title: U.S. Teacher Held In Poland for 24 Hours
description: An American schoolteacher said today that she was detained for 24 hours by the Polish police and threatened with jail unless she agreed to leave the country within a week, leaving her Polish husband behind.

title: MARQUEST MEDICAL PRODUCTS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 28
Wells Fargo's Dealings
description: Executives of Wells Fargo & Company met with Treasury officials last week to discuss the bank's handling of large cash transactions, it disclosed. Other banks have been fined for failure to report such transactions.

title: FREDA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
EULOGY CITES COURAGE OF MARILYN KLINGHOFFER
description: To her family and friends, Marilyn Klinghoffer was a heroine long before the world embraced her as one for speaking out against international terrorism. In his eulogy yesterday, Rabbi Harvey M. Tattelbaum spoke of the courage with which she fought her private battles - in helping her husband to recover from a devastating stroke, and against the cancer that finally killed her.

title: General Re Stock
description: The General Re Corporation, an insurance holding company, is offering 2.5 million common shares at $114.50 a share through underwriters led by Morgan Stanley & Company. Most of the proceeds will go to General Re's property-casualty reinsurance subsidiaries to support anticipated growth, the company said.

title: WESTERN INVESTMENT REAL ESTATE INCOME TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $335,000 from the disposition of property.

title: RICHARDSON PASSES DRUG TEST AND JOINS NETS IN CLEVELAND
description: Micheal Ray Richardson passed a league-ordered drug test yesterday and joined his Net teammates in Cleveland last night. But he was demoted to the club's fourth guard by Coach Dave Wohl and faces a difficult battle to regain both his credibility and his starting job.

title: STEWART INFORMATION SERVCES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a gain of $869,000 from the sale of real estate.

title: HBO TO TEST A NEW SERVICE, FESTIVAL
description: Home Box Office, the nation's largest pay-television company, will begin test marketing a third cable entertainment service next month called Festival, to attract older, more conservative television viewers who HBO officials say have been reluctant to buy cable service.

title: Connors Beats Denton
description: Third-seeded Jimmy Connors defeated Steve Denton, 6-2, 6-4, tonight in the first round of the Lipton International Players Championships tennis tournament.

title: TYLENOL INQUIRY OFFICIALS FIND '82 CASE UNRELATED
description: Federal officials have ruled out any connection between the death in Yonkers of a woman who had taken Extra-Strength Tylenol laced with potassium cyanide and the 1982 deaths of seven people who were also poisoned by Tylenol capsules tainted with cyanide.

title: Peres Outlines a Plan to Cut Israeli Control in West Bank
description: Prime Minister Shimon Peres outlined to Parliament today a plan to reduce Israeli control over the day-to-day life of Palestinians in the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip.

title: Search for Copter Resumes
description: The search for a chartered helicopter carrying three people, including a free-lance photographer making pictures of Mount St. Helens for National Geographic magazine, resumed today under clearing skies.

title: NATIONAL SAVINGS BANK (ALBAY) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including extraordinary gains of $282,000 for the latest first quarter and $272,000 for the year-ago first quarter. The company converted to stock form of ownership in November and did not report per share earnings for the year-ago period.

title: ST JUDE MEDICAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a tax credit of $1.4 million. c-Net income.

title: MILLIPORE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Net income for 1984 excludes a nonrecurring tax credit of $4,002,000, or 29 cents a share, from the reversal of deferred taxes on DISC income as a result of the Tax Reform Act of 1984.

title: CHEEKS FOILS BULLS
description: Philadelphia's Maurice Cheeks scored 9 points in the final period tonight to cut short a Chicago rally and help the 76ers to a 106-98 victory.

title: GENENTECH INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shares earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split announced Jan. 21, 1986 for shareholders of record Feb. 1.

title: RESCUING THE HOUSEPLANT IN DISTRESS
description: THERE is barely controlled panic in the recorded message that Jane Gil finds awaiting her on the telephone tape: ''It's urgent - you gotta come over and save my houseplant -the leaves are yellowing, dropping, and it's dying! ''

title: OPERATING PROFIT RISES 26% AT GAF
description: The GAF Corporation, the specialty chemicals and building materials company, reported yesterday that income from continuing operations rose 26 percent in the fourth quarter. But net income fell 7.6 percent, reflecting a higher level of extraordinary credits in the fourth quarter of 1984.

title: Since When Are Anyone's Rights Not Worthy of Protection?
description: To the Editor:

title: AMERICAN REALTY TRUST reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Including aggregate proceeds of $18.5 million from the sale of the Williamsburg Hospitality House in October 1984.

title: 2 AGENCIES TEST UNUSUAL OFFERINGS Sallie Mae: Inverse Yield
description: The Student Loan Marketing Association, which makes a secondary market in Government-insured student loans, yesterday announced a new kind of debt security offered through underwriters led by Morgan Stanley & Company. S.L.M.A., often called Sallie Mae, is privately owned and federally chartered.

title: DEBT NOTICES GO TO 65,000 FARMERS
description: Nearly three dozen farmers in Nebraska are the first of more than 65,000 around the country to receive letters from the Farmers Home Administration notifying them that they must restructure or renegotiate their loan payments or face foreclosure.

title: U.S. EXTRADITES CROAT TO YUGOSLAVIA
description: An 86-year-old Croat described as the highest-ranking Nazi war criminal to enter the United States was flown today to Yugoslavia to face mass murder charges dating from World War II.

title: U.S. IS SAID TO AID CONTRAS VIA SALVADOR
description: United States assistance to Nicaraguan guerrillas has recently been channeled through El Salvador, according to American and Nicaraguan exile officials, apparently in an effort to make up for a recent cutoff of supplies by Honduras.

title: TSO FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PROTESTER OF GEORGIA GRADES POLICY WINS SUIT
description: A Federal jury ruled here today that a University of Georgia instructor had been dismissed illegally in retaliation for opposing favored treatment for athletes. The jury awarded Jan Kemp more than $2.5 million for lost wages, mental anguish and punitive damages.

title: N.A.A.C.P. BOARD MEETS AT A TIME OF TROUBLES
description: As the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People prepares to hold its annual board meeting this weekend in New York City, the organization faces a variety of problems and a debate over its leadership.

title: MONARCH CAPITAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a capital loss of $2,415,000 in the quarter and including a $9.9 million gain from investments and a $6.8 million gain from the sale of Fidelity Bankers Life Insurance Co. in the year. c-After a capital loss of $1,346,000 in the quarter and including a nonrecurring gain of $1.4 million from the reversal of deferred taxes in the year.

title: VALMONT INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income

title: Bert Lance Must Drop Bank Ties
description: Bert Lance has been permanently barred from association with any banking institution as part of a settlement in a suit brought by the Comptroller of the Currency charging check kiting and illegal use of bank funds by Mr. Lance. The consent order was announced by the Comptroller today.

title: Since When Are Anyone's Rights Not Worthy of Protection?
description: To the Editor:

title: WITH EWING OUT, KNICKS FALL APART
description: With Patrick Ewing, the Knicks - even these Knicks - are capable of defeating any team in the league, as they have proven this season with victories over such powerful opponents as the Boston Celtics and the Los Angeles Lakers. Without Ewing, though, defeating any team becomes an overwhelming struggle.

title: Advertising; Calvin Cooler Awarded
description: Warwick Advertising said that Joseph Victori Wines Inc. had awarded it the $10 million Calvin Cooler account. The agency said Calvin Cooler is the fifth-largest brand in the booming wine cooler category and the leader in the Northeast.

title: TRIBUNAL WEIGHS DEATH FOR SAILOR
description: A court-martial reconvened today to decide whether a petty officer who was convicted last month of murdering his superior officer should be the first sailor executed by the Navy since 1849.

title: Owners 8, Players 4
description: Gary Pettis, California's Gold Glove outfielder, lost his salary arbitration case but still wound up more than doubling his 1985 salary. Pettis, who batted .257 and had 56 stolen bases, will earn $300,000 next season after having a $125,000 salary last year.

title: ANTIQUES DEALERS' SECRET SUPPLIES
description: SALLIE and Maynard Langford make a profession of combing the Adirondack back country in their green Chevrolet van, searching out American antiques, objets d'art and, recently, 1940's and 50's furniture. They knock on the doors of strangers, browse through tag sales, rummage through country antiques shops and, sometimes, persuade the owners of large Adirondack camps to part with original pieces.

title: 'GROWING UP CATHOLIC,' THE MAKING OF A SPOOF
description: Not long ago they were four young laborers in the vineyards of the New York book-publishing industry. Today, still in their 20's and 30's, they are the successful authors of the surprise best seller ''Growing Up Catholic,'' an irreverent but affectionate spoof of the rites and rituals of the Roman Catholic Church, which has more than 50 million members in the United States.

title: ROCHESTER TELEPHONE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MASLAND, C H & SONS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $837,000.

title: TEXAS AIR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a reversal of tax credits of $13,918,000 and includes special charges of $17.8 million in severance pay to former striking pilots and $6 million for reorganization-related expenses. c-Net income d-After tax credits of $5,769,000 for the quarter and $22,545,000 for the year. e-After a tax credit of $42,366,000 and includes a special charge of $17.8 million, a special charge of $15.7 million for reorganization expenses and a $1.5 million gain from the sale of assets.

title: REFLECTONE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
INNOVATIVE GLASS
description: THEY met in graduate school and have been partners for three years.

title: ROSPATCH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
JAPAN'S CHALLENGE IN THE EUROMARKETS
description: When the Canadian Government wanted to replenish its reserves of United States dollars two weeks ago, it chose not to borrow in the dollar markets directly but, instead, floated the largest Euroyen issue in history.

title: No Loophole at Georgia
description: The University of Georgia will not make use of a loophole allowing admission of student-athletes who fail to meet the National Collegiate Athletic Association's new academic-eligibility requirements, according to Dr. Fred C. Davison, the university president.

title: QUESTAR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a gain of $9,176,000, or 51 cents a share, from an accounting change. The share earnings in both 1985 periods were increased by a reduction in preferred dividends from the redemption of $34 million in preferred stock in September 1985.

title: GAF CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including extraordinary credits of $1,188,000 for the quarter and $23,285,000 for the year. c-Including extraordinary credits of $4,818,000 for the quarter and $15,656,000 for the year.

title: Reunion in Chinatown
description: It was a Sunday night. And Chinese food brought them together. But nothing else was the same when Richard Mei Jr. greeted Representative Bill Green, Republican of Manhattan, at a Chinese New Year's banquet.

title: AMCA INTERNATIONAL LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net losses after losses from discontinued operations of $799,000 for the quarter and $6,722,000 for the year. In the latest quarter and year preferred dividend requirements exceeded net income so there were no share earnings.

title: G & K SERVICES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 28
AMPCO-PITTSBURGH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $5,105,000 for the quarter and $5,900,000 for the year.

title: A New Tune on Currency Values
description: It was only a line in the State of the Union address last week calling for a world conference on currency exchange, but with it President Reagan heralded a significant change in Administration thinking. It acknowledges the failure of a decadelong experiment with official indifference to flexible exchange rates.

title: Millstone 3 Plant Tests Its Nuclear Operation
description: The Millstone 3 plant used nuclear power to generate electricity for the first time today as Northeast Utilities continued testing the $3.8 billion facility, which is scheduled to begin commercial operations in May.

title: CONTINENTAL AIRLINES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a charge for severance pay to former striking pilots of $17.8 million for the quarter and year, and after charges from reorganization-related expenses of $6 million for the quarter, $15.7 million for the year. The results for the quarter also includes a reversal of a tax credit of $11,999,000. The results for the year also includes a gain of $1.5 million from the sale of assets. c-Including tax credits of $6,071,000 for the quarter and $21,112,000 for the year. d-Net income.

title: BONNER ATTENDS NEW YORK DINNER
description: Yelena G. Bonner, still frail from heart surgery last month, sat at a table in the Regency Hotel ballroom on Monday and welcomed dinner guests who had come to assure her that they would continue to press the Soviet Union to allow her and her husband, Andrei D. Sakharov, to emigrate.

title: CHRIS-CRAFT INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net losses after losses from discontinued operations of $11,113,000 for the quarter and $28,046,000 for the year.

title: WM WRIGLEY JR CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Flaws Are Cited in Treasury Computers
description: Two confidential studies have concluded that the computerized network that the Government uses to transfer $1 billion to $2 billion a day around the United States is riddled with serious security problems.

title: BARD, C R INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Advertising; BellSouth Buys Agent
description: The BellSouth Corporation said that it had agreed to purchase L. M. Berry & Company, which it said was the largest independent advertising sales agent for Yellow Page directories. Terms were not disclosed, but the sale price was reported to be in the hundreds of millions of dollars. Berry had sales last year of $800 million, the company said.

title: MMI MEDICAL reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss. c-Including an extraordinary gain of $474,000.

title: LEAVING INQUIRY BEHIND, KOCH TOURS BOSTON
description: The subjects ranged from the serious to the frivolous, and so did Mayor Koch's mood today as he came here and to Boston on the latest leg of what might be called a book and government tour.

title: AT DARTMOUTH, THE RIGHT BORROWS THE PROTEST MANTLE OF THE LEFT
description: As radical student organizations go, there is not much in the style of The Dartmouth Review that is unusual. Not recognized by the college from which it takes its name, the paper slings barbs at the administration, faculty and fellow students from two ramshackle rooms over the hardware store on Main Street, the walls decorated with satiric posters and framed photos of heroes in the struggle.

title: GLADYS MEYER
description: Gladys Meyer, professor emeritus of sociology at Barnard College, died Jan. 30 at her home in Manhattan. She was 77 years old.

title: FIRST VERMONT FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results for the latest year include Banknorth Group Inc., acquired on Dec. 31, 1985, and accounted for on a pooling-of-interests basis.

title: COUSINS HOME FURNISHINGS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of 97 cents a share for the quarter and 6 months. c-Net loss.

title: French Police Question Suspects in Bombings
description: French policemen in five cities carried out simultaneous raids this morning on the homes of several dozen people of Middle Eastern origin and questioned them about a series of bombing attacks that wounded 21 people in Paris last week, a police spokesman said.

title: ARCO CUTS SPENDING $1.6 BILLION
description: Concerned that oil prices may stay at their current depressed levels for much of the year, the Atlantic Richfield Company said yesterday that it had cut its 1986 budget for capital spending to $2 billion from $3.6 billion.

title: MANDELA SAID TO REJECT RELEASE IF IT MEANS EXILE
description: Winnie Mandela said today that her husband, the black nationalist leader Nelson Mandela, would not accept exile in Zambia as a condition for his release.

title: PUGET SOUND POWER & LIGHT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a writeoff of $47,579,000 for the quarter and year. c-Net loss The writeoff in 1984 is related to an abandoned nuclear project.

title: INDOOR TRACK'S OSTRICHES
description: In the money mathematics of indoor track-and-field meets, Carl Lewis equals 12 Russian and Rumanian athletes.

title: TOP OFFICER RESIGNS HOLLY SUGAR POSTS
description: The Holly Sugar Corporation, one of the nation's largest sugar processing companies, said yesterday that John L. Bushnell, president and chief executive, had resigned. Charles Azarow, vice chairman for finance and marketing, was named his successor.

title: DOW RISES 7.11 TO ANOTHER RECORD
description: Snapping back from a one-day slump, the Dow Jones industrial average rose again to a record level yesterday. The broader market advanced moderately on technical factors and a continued weakness in oil prices.

title: STAGE: CHUMA'S 'HOUSING PROJECT'
description: ''HALALA!,'' which means ''congratulations'' in Zulu, drumbeats its resistance to oppressive authority. This musical collage, written and directed by Welcome Msomi, expresses its faith in all fighters for freedom, saluting the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and Malcolm X as well as Steve Biko and other African martyrs. The show, at the Douglas Fairbanks Theater, makes a point that demands constant reiteration, but, as musical theater, it pays a price for its own ingenuousness.

title: Since When Are Anyone's Rights Not Worthy of Protection?
description: To the Editor:

title: UTAH TOWN THAT MADE BOOSTER ROCKET SHUDDERS AT FUTURE
description: To the 17,000 people who live here in the shadow of the Wasatch mountains, it suddenly seems the whole world has turned on them.

title: REVERE COPPER & BRASS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $1,702,000 for the quarter and a charge of $280,000 for the year from the settlement of liabilities under a plan of reorganization, an extraordinary tax charge of $1,748,000 for the quarter and a tax credit of $700,000 for the year. c-Net income. d-Net loss.

title: NOBILITY HOMES reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 2
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $417,727 for the quarter and year from equity in losses of Mobile Home Park Ltd. partnerships. c-Net income including an extraordinary gain of $678,756 from the sale of a plant facility in June 1984.

title: CONCERT: PHILHARMONIC AND JUILLIARD ORCHESTRA
description: THERE stood Zubin Mehta, like Napoleon at Austerlitz, proudly surveying his massed troops, which if one looked closely turned out to be the combined orchestras of the New York Philharmonic and the Juilliard School. To accommodate the doubled ranks and files, seven rows of front seats had been removed and Avery Fisher Hall's stage was thrust out into the audience area. Cannons to the right of him, cannons to the left of him, volley and thunder. In the Wagner selections that closed the evening, the conductor had what appeared to be 16 or perhaps 18 double basses drawn up on his right flank and seven harps on his left.

title: EX-AGENT OF F.B.I. FACES 2D SPY TRIAL
description: Richard W. Miller, the first agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation ever accused of espionage, goes on trial for the second time Thursday.

title: DATARAM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Including gains from the sale of securities of $304,000 for the quarter and $785,000 for the 9 months. c-Net loss after a loss of $2,009,000 from discontinued operations.

title: WINDMERE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a nonrecurring charge of $2.5 million, for the quarter and the year, principally due to the company's withdrawal from the rotary shaver business, the writedown of an investment in a marketable security and the estimated cost of disposing of the company's joint venture interest in the United Kingdom. c-Net income.

title: CAMPANELLI HELPS TEAM BOUNCE BACK
description: The view from the well-appointed office is quite spectacular for a February afternoon, particularly for a recent arrival from the East.

title: REUTERS HOLDINGS PLC reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $1.8 million from the sale of United Kingdom subsidiary. The 1984 figures were restated to reflect the merger in 1985 of Rich Inc. The company said it used an exchange rate of $1.45 equals one pound for both periods. The results are in U.S. currency.

title: EX-NEW YORKERS STILL DONATE TO THE NEEDIEST
description: Former New Yorkers are among the contributors to the 74th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Competing Phone Book Is Planned
description: Southwestern Bell Publications said yesterday that it would publish Yellow Pages business directories for Manhattan and the metropolitan areas of Baltimore and Washington.

title: Advest-Dainana Stock Swap Plan
description: Advest Group of Hartford and the Dainana Securities Company of Tokyo said they were planning to buy minority interests in each other.

title: TALLEY INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HOME IMPROVEMENT
description: ALTHOUGH modern paint rollers are extremely easy to use and certainly have made painting the inside of a house faster and simpler, they are still not completely foolproof. The wrong type of roller cover or improper use of the roller can cause disappointing results. In addition, many people are unfamiliar with tricks that can speed and simplify many jobs.

title: KAY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including and extraordinary gain of $2,778,000, or 65 cents a share, for the quarter and year and a gain of $472,000, or 11 cents a share, for the year from the sale of assets.

title: Amherst Board Votes License for Wood Stoves
description: The Town Health Board, seeking to cut the pall of wood smoke that lingers on cold mornings, voted unanimously today to require tests and licenses before residents can light fireplaces and wood stoves next winter.

title: PROCESSED-FOOD MAKERS CRITICIZED ON SODIUM
description: Few manufacturers have reduced the salt in their processed foods despite concern over the link between sodium and high blood pressure, a consumer group asserted today. It said some foods checked last year were actually higher in salt than a year earlier.

title: ARROW AUTOMOTIVE INDUSRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 28
description: b-Net income.

title: SEAGULL ENERGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Poles and Money
description: The staff of the International Monetary Fund has completed a technical assessment of Poland's application for membership, and the fund might just approve it before the end of the year. Membership would clear the way for Poland to borrow money to help handle a balance-of-payments problem.

title: Not Even Close
description: The Islanders made a mistake. The shutout posted by Billy Smith against Vancouver on Tuesday night was actually only the 19th of his career - not the 20th, as announced by the club, which had erroneously included a shutout that Smith shared with Goran Hagosta seven years ago. Not that it will make any difference in the list of history's N.H.L. shutout leaders, which reads this way: Terry Sawchuk103 George Hainsworth94 Glenn Hall84 Jacques Plante82 Tiny Thompson81 Alex Connell80 Tony Esposito76 Lorne Chabot73 Harry Lumley71 Roy Worters66

title: DRUG INDICTMENTS OF 50 AIRLINE WORKERS EXPECTED
description: Law-enforcement officials said last night that up to 50 employees of Eastern Airlines faced indictments stemming from an investigation of a drug-smuggling operation that began last August.

title: KINNEY SYSTEM INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
G.M.A.C. Selling $600 Million Notes
description: The General Motors Acceptance Corporation is offering $600 million of notes, equally divided between three-year and seven-year maturities, through underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation.

title: SANMARK-STARDUST INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings have been adjusted to reflect a 4-for-3 stock split paid Jan. 27.

title: BUBKA LOW KEY FOR TEST
description: When the five Soviet track and field athletes and the three officials stepped off their plane yesterday at Kennedy International Airport, the women were hatless. The men wore fur hats - fox, raccoon and, in one case, mink.

title: RANGER OFFENSE IS SOLID
description: The Rangers showered the Vancouver goal with 50 shots in a 5-2 victory last night at Madison Square Garden. Late in the game, fans showered the Canuck bench with beer and soft drinks, and that seemed to disturb Vancouver even more than the defeat.

title: BUSINESS MEN'S ASSURANCE CO OF AMERICA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including investments gains of $999,000 for the quarter and $12,197,000 for the year. c-After investment losses of $766,000 for the quarter and including an investment gain of $593,000 for the year. Results for the previous year also include a gain of $15.9 million from a change in Federal income tax law.

title: NEW MET OPERA SEASON
description: The 30-week 1986-87 season of the Metropolitan Opera will open Sept. 22 with a new production of ''Die Walkure'' by Richard Wagner, the inauguration of a new ''Ring des Nibelungen'' that will be completed by the 1988-89 season, when the entire cycle will be presented. Otto Schenk will direct, with designs by Gunther Schneider-Siemssen. James Levine is to conduct, and the opening-night ''Walkure'' cast will include Hildegard Behrens as Brunnhilde, Jeannine Altmeyer as Sieglinde (in later performances, she will move up to Brunnhilde and Johanna Meier will sing Sieglinde), Brigitte Fassbander, Peter Hofmann, Simon Estes and Aage Haugland.

title: THE SUCCESSFUL RISE OF DISNEY'S 'DOWN AND OUT'
description: The chairman of the Walt Disney Company's movie division climbed onto a conference table, fulfilling a promise cheerfully though with a certain amount of embarrassment.

title: FURNACE PUFFBACKS LEAVE SOOTY MESS
description: MODERN heating systems are quite dependable, with very little attention needed from the homeowner. When a breakdown occurs, a professional can usually solve the problem quickly.

title: SPECTRADYNE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PATIENT FINDS JUST EXISTING IS NOT LIVING
description: In High Desert Hospital, at the tip of the Mojave Desert, Elizabeth Bouvia says that since she lost a court battle to end her life more than two years ago her greatest struggle has been to find a private physician to provide her with the drugs she says she needs.

title: Now the Acid Rain's Headed Our Way
description: Sometime this month, a vast smelter at Nacozari, Mexico, 55 miles south of the Arizona border, will start to cook copper ore. At full production, it will be the second-largest source of sulfur dioxide in North America, emitting 500,000 tons a year. Blown north, the acrid gas could increase by nearly 50 percent the burden of acid rain that already threatens the fragile ecology of the Rocky Mountains.

title: SCHRARANSKY TELLS HOW HE CLUNG TO PSALMS CAPTORS TRIED TO SEIZE
description: Anatoly B. Shcharansky, describing his release from a Soviet labor camp, said today that he had flung himself into the snow and refused to continue on his way because his escorts tried to confiscate a book of Psalms that his wife had sent him from Israel.

title: CHAPARRAL RESOURCES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $1,720,000 from the early retirment of debt for the quarter and year. c-Net losses.

title: CORRECTION
description: A picture caption in some editions on Monday with an article about vandalism at Duvalier family estates in Haiti misidentified one place that was looted. It was a home of Joan B. Thiesfeld, a sister-in-law of President Jean-Claude Duvalier.

title: REAGAN'S 'CHOKE POINTS' STRETCH FROM SEA TO SEA
description: Pentagon officials said today that 16 geographical ''choke points'' referred to Tuesday by President Reagan included a wide variety of ocean transit areas, ranging from the Panama Canal to stretches of ocean that are hundreds of miles wide between Greenland and Iceland and Britain.

title: Students Riot in Karachi
description: Policemen fired tear gas at rioting right-wing students who set six buses ablaze and damaged 16 others in Karachi today, witnesses said. They said the students were protesting what they called inaction by the Pakistani Government in curbing lawlessness in colleges after the death of a colleague who was shot last month.

title: NATHAN'S FAMOUS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 29
description: b-Including a tax credit of $337,000.

title: CONCERT: PRISM PLAYS RUSIN
description: ANDREW RUDIN, a composer whose electronic works have been heard, among other places, in the soundtrack to Federico Fellini's ''Satyricon,'' presented a concert of his works for conventional performing forces Tuesday at Symphony Space. Members of the ensemble known as Prism - the pianist Cameron Grant most prominent and impressive among them - were conducted by Robert Black.

title: POE & ASSOCIATES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss after losses from discontinued operations of $1,471,000 for the quarter and $2,013,000 for the year.

title: MISSION PLAN
description: The Mission Insurance Group and the California Department of Insurance have reached agreement on a rehabilitation plan for the insurer and its subsidiaries. The plan, which is scheduled to be heard in State Superior Court on March 6, calls for the Mission American Insurance Company, a Mission Insurance Group subsidiary, to assume most of the financial obligations of the Mission Insurance Company, another subsidiary that was declared insolvent last October.

title: WARNER COMMUNICATIONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including net gains of $86 million for the quarter and year from the sale to Viacom International of Warner Communications' interest in Showtime-The Movie Channel Inc., as well as Warner's equity interest in Warner Amex's gain on the sale of its interest in MTV Networks Inc. and its holdings in Showtime. Net income for the year also includes an approximate gain of $8.2 million from a sale in the second quarter of a portion of Warner Communications' interest in Hasbro Inc. c-Net losses after losses from discontinued operations of $225 million for the quarter and $611,718,000 for the year and an extraordinary gain of $12.5 million for the year.

title: Firefighters Picket
description: Off-duty firefighters picketed City Hall today to focus attention on the city's failure to pay the 5 percent wage increase promised in their contract. Representatives of the City Council, Civil Service Commission and the Mayor's office called a meeting to discuss the situation. A strike is set for March 1.

title: Working Profile: William Penn Mott Jr.; On the Inside Looking Out of It
description: When William Penn Mott Jr. was named director of the National Park Service last year, conservationists feared the news was too good to be true.

title: All Dressed Up
description: After a 105-92 loss to the Seattle SuperSonics, Coach Frank Layden finds Utah lacking in work ethic: ''Some guys play in tuxedos, and some in overalls. We played in our finest.''

title: HERSHEY FOODS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $658,000 for the quarter and $1,753,000 for the year. c-After a loss from discontinued operations of $8,422,000.

title: INTERNATIONAL HOLDING CAPIAL reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After extraordinary charges of $13,000 for the quarter and $78,000 for the year. c-Including an extraordinary credit of $131,000 for the quarter and year.

title: NATIONAL EDUCATION CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $972,000, or 10 cents a share, from the sale of property and the company's home healthcare operation. c-Including a gain of $2,133,000, or 20 cents a share, from the sale of investment and after a charge of $1,091,000 relating to prepublication expenses and inventory writeoff.

title: Copter Crash Kills 3 At Mount St. Helens
description: Searchers today found a helicopter that crashed north of Mount St. Helens, killing all three aboard, including a man on assignment to photograph the volcano for National Geographic, the authorities said.

title: JAPAN PLANS TO EXTEND AUTO CURBS
description: In a move to ease trade frictions with the United States, Japan announced this morning that it would continue its export restraints on automobiles for a sixth year, beginning in April.

title: SCIENTIFIC MICRO SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a tax credit of $1,399,000. c-Net income.

title: KN Energy Sets Mesa Bid Review
description: KN Energy Inc., a Colorado-based natural gas distribution company, said it would review an unsolicited takeover from Mesa Limited Partnership when KN Energy's directors meet on Feb. 20.

title: Gas Access Deadline Delay
description: The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission yesterday postponed the deadline by which natural gas pipelines have to decide whether to open their lines to all producers, including those offering cheap gas. The commission voted 3 to 1 to move the deadline from Saturday, to July 1.

title: TII INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 27
description: b-After equity in net losses of an affiliate of $672,000 for the quarter and $1,284,000 for the 6 months. c-After equity in net losses of an affiliate of $66,000 for the quarter and $132,000 for the 6 months and including tax credit of $16,000 for the quarter and $35,000 for the 6 months.

title: France Offers Plan for Managing Exchange Rates
description: Following President Reagan's call for greater exchange rate stability in his State of the Union Message last week, the French Government is circulating a paper in Washington and other capitals calling for international management of currencies through a series of flexible ''reference zones.''

title: METALBANC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net losses.

title: Banished
description: Pat Riley of the Los Angeles Lakers, tossed out of a game Tuesday night for the first time in his coaching career: ''There's no popcorn in the locker room, no beer or anything. It's lousy.''

title: HOW BALLOTS ARE COUNTED BY ASSEMBLY
description: The Philippine National Assembly, the focus of the unsettled election, is a legislative body that is under the control of President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: NO THRONE, BUT KING HOLDS COURT IN YORUBA LAND
description: A swath of torn roadway elbows through the thinning rain forest here, hooking through a few reddish mud-walled buildings that cling precariously to its edges.

title: LEINER, P NUTRITIONAL PRODUCTS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
A JITTERY CITY HALL STRUGGLES WITH BUSINESS AMID SCANDAL
description: On Edward I. Koch's desk, amid glass apples and gold Manhattan skylines, are two framed checks, dated 1869. They are whimsical mementos of corruption, signed by city officials who were part of the infamous Tweed ring and displayed by a Mayor who has prided himself on clean government.

title: Keep Affirmative Action
description: With the utmost sincerity, President Reagan says he shares Dr. Martin Luther King's ideal of a color-blind society. I don't question his sincerity. But the Administration's apparent intention, pushed by Attorney General Edwin Meese 3d, to emasculate Federal affirmative action requirements, belies this claim.

title: U.S. Advisers Reported Under Fire in Salvador
description: United States military advisers accompanying an army operation came under rebel fire last week, Salvadoran officials said today.

title: Since When Are Anyone's Rights Not Worthy of Protection?
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising; Bristol-Myers Shifts Some Clairol Accounts
description: The Bristol-Myers Company said that it was moving the accounts for several of its Clairol brands from Foote, Cone & Belding to Doyle Dane Bernbach, Grey Advertising and Laurence, Charles, Free & Lawson.

title: NUVISION INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After reductions of $273,000 for the quarter and $573,000 from pro forma adjustment for income taxes on Bell Optical Inc. earnings had it been a taxable entity. c-After a reduction of $37,000 from pro forma adjustment for income taxes on Bell Optical Inc. earnings had it been a taxable entity.

title: RAYMOND CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Burroughs Cuts
description: The Burroughs Corporation said it would lay off 810 workers in a consolidation of production operations in California, Colorado, Florida and Scotland.

title: Saudis and Heat
description: Most buildings in downtown Washington have gas heating. Not so the old mansion off Dupont Circle that used to house the Embassy of Saudi Arabia, a country awash with oil as prices plummet.

title: POOR RECORDS SAID TO HINDER PARKING BUREAU REVIEW
description: A city official investigating the operations of the city's Parking Violations Bureau said yesterday that his review was being hindered by incomplete and unaccountably missing records.

title: Honors for Civic Helpers
description: The Citizens Committee for New York City, dedicated to making the city a better place to live, publishes useful information and aids fledgling block associations. It has helped with the Community Patrol Officer program, and it administers programs to beautify New York and provides workshops for training community leaders.

title: FRIEDMAN INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Cost, Not Accountability, Is the Malpractice Issue
description: To the Editor:

title: EQUATORIAL COMMUNICATIONS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $3,197,000. c-Including an extraordinary gain $59,000.

title: AUTHOR OF THE 'DUNE' NOVELS
description: The science-fiction writer Frank Herbert, whose best-selling ''Dune'' told of a harsh desert planet and its people, the intrigues of an interplanetary empire and a mysterious spice that made a young duke able to see the future, died of cancer Tuesday at University of Wisconsin Hospital. He was 65 years old and lived in Mercer Island, Wash.

title: National-Xerox Technology Pact
description: The National Semiconductor Corporation announced a long-term agreement to exchange intergrated chip technology with the Xerox Corporation.

title: MASCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results include restatement for a company acquired on a pooling-of interests basis.

title: Genentech Net Soars
description: Genentech Inc., the leading biotechnology company, said today that it earned $2.2 million, or 7 cents a share, in the fourth quarter, more than three times the $612,000, or 2 cents a share, a year ago. The earnings per share reflect a 2-for-1 stock split announced on Jan. 21.

title: INDEPENDENT INSURANCE GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After investment losses of $14,856,000 for the quarter and $12,586,000 for the year. c-Net income. d-After a realized investment loss of $5,118,000 for the quarter and including a realized investment gain of $218,000 for the year and also including increases in net income of $558,000, or 7 cents a share, for the quarter and $19,218,000, or $2.61 a share, for the year from a nonrecurring adjustment of deferred taxes.

title: XL/DATACOMP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company went public in March 1985.

title: CHIEF OF INTERFACE SEEKS TRADE SHOW-TRAVEL TIE
description: Sheldon G. Adelson has invested in about 75 businesses since he first hawked newspapers on a Boston street corner when he was 11 years old.

title: PARADYNE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After provisions of $2.3 million for the quarter and $13.5 million for the year for slow-moving, obsolete inventory and off-lease equipment. c-Net income.

title: 2 Brands of Brie Cheese Being Recalled in U.S.
description: A subsidiary of General Foods has issued a nationwide recall of two brands of imported Brie cheese after the Food and Drug Administration discovered a bacteria found to have been reponsible for 69 deaths last year in California and six other Western states, an agency spokesman said today.

title: VALSPAR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 24
description: b-Includes a pretax gain of $1,022,000 from the sale of property.

title: Achievers and Dyslexia
description: Nelson A. Rockefeller, Albert Einstein, Winston Churchill, Woodrow Wilson and Gen. George S. Patton all accomplished a great deal despite a common handicap: All suffered from dyslexia, an impairment of the ability to read.

title: FOE OF MARCOS SENSED PERIL, RELATIVES SAY
description: The wife and sister of Evelio Javier, a leading member of the Philppine opposition movement who was shot and killed on Tuesday, said that Mr. Javier sensed that he would be killed before the end of the election process.

title: LEUCADIA IN OFFER TO ACQUIRE GATX
description: The GATX Corporation, the troubled rail car leasing and shipping concern, said today that it had received an unsolicited $494 million acquisition offer from the Leucadia National Corporation.

title: Auto Makers' Attitudes
description: Executives of the American automobile companies have taken varying attitudes toward the continuation of restrictions on car imports from Japan.

title: I.O.C. Considers Admitting Pros
description: Professional hockey, soccer and tennis players and other pros could participate in the Olympics under a prospective rule change, Juan Antonio Samaranch, the president of the International Olympic Committee, said today.

title: Raising the Stakes
description: In their battle for supremacy on the fall marathon circuit, the New York City Marathon and its same-day rival, the America's Marathon in Chicago, which have been in a hot competition to attract top runners, have been upstaged by an upstart. Officials of The Twin Cities Marathon in Minneapolis-St.

title: Tool Blamed for Copter Flaw
description: Cracks in the main rotor blades in a dozen of the Army's AH-64 Apache helicopter were caused by a design flaw in a hand tool, the McDonnell Douglas Helicopter Company said today.

title: SPY FOR CHINA HAD A PASSION FOR GAMBLING, RECORDS SHOW
description: Larry Wu-Tai Chin, who gained $180,000 for spying for China over a 30-year period, gambled with a passion that contrasted with his courtroom demeanor as a scholarly translator for the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 13, 1986
description: International

title: FOR PREDESIGNED HOMES, A LONG AND THRIVING BUSINESS
description: MOST of Judy and Jerry Pruitt's neighbors in Hickory, N.C., an affluent community 35 miles north of Charlotte, hired architects to design their homes. So the first obvious step for the Pruitts, who wanted a large home for themselves and their two children, was to find an architect.

title: CALENDAR: WORKS OF ARCHITECTS
description: ''Directions in Architecture: A Dialogue With Architect John Hejduk and Poet David Shapiro,'' Cooper-Hewitt Museum, 2 East 91st Street, 212-860-6868.

title: Latin Debtors Meeting
description: The monitoring committee of the Cartagena debtors group is planning to meet Feb. 27 and 28 in Punta del Este, Uruguay. Foreign ministers of five nations forming the Cartagena monitoring committee - Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Mexico and Venezuela - met in Washington earlier this week in response to a call for an emergency meeting by the latter two countries.

title: NEWS SUMMARY: THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 13, 1986
description: International The Administration moved to curb confusion and uncertainty created in the Philippines by statements made by President Reagan about the unresolved presidential election there. The statements were widely interpreted in the Philippines as an endorsement of President Ferdinand E. Marcos. Officials said the State Department had sent instructions to the American Ambassador in Manila to assure Corazon C. Aquino, Mr. Marcos's challenger, that Mr. Reagan did not intend to imply that he was reconciled to a victory by Mr. Marcos. [ Page A1, Column 6. ]

title: Texaco Case
description: Texaco Inc. said yesterday that the Texas Supreme Court had rejected its request for a hearing on whether a Texas trial judge was qualified to have presided over the Pennzoil Company's multibillion-dollar suit against Texaco. A Texas appeals court last week rejected without a hearing Texaco's motion that Judge Solomon Casseb be disqualified.

title: WOLVERINE TECHNOLOGIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $32,000 for the quarter and $126,000 for the year.

title: 2 DANGLE FOR 4 HOURS AS POWER LINES SNAG A PLANE
description: A single-engine airplane preparing to land here Tuesday night flew into high-voltage lines 80 feet above the ground, snagging the plane and leaving the two occupants dangling upside-down in their seat belts for four hours.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond BuyerSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: ROBINSON CONTROLS FAIRFIELD
description: Navy showed Fairfield and the crowd of 5,118 in Byrne Meadowlands Arena tonight why David Robinson is one of the best collegiate centers in the country.

title: Conservatives and Board
description: ''Only conservatives need apply,'' warns the advertisement appearing in Human Rights, a conservative weekly. Which is not too odd these days in Washington.

title: CITICORP IN VIDEOTEX VENTURE
description: Jumping into a crowded but so far disappointing market, Citicorp said yesterday that it would team up with RCA and Nynex to provide information electronically to homes.

description: b-After a loss of $650,000 from discontinued operations.

title: LOGS FROM NEWSPAPERS
description: NEWSPAPER stack racks keep newspapers organized, and log presses make them into logs for the fire. The newspaper stack rack from the Hold Everything catalogue stores more than a week's worth of newspapers, which can then be recycled, bundled or made into logs.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: THE ART OF COMMERCE The Equitable Life Assurance Society has constructed a new headquarters tower in midtown Manhattan, at 787 Seventh Avenue, between 51st and 52d Streets. And on that site is the newest - and largest - branch of the Whitney Museum of American Art,which opens today at 11 A.M. There are two galleries - one for short-term shows, one for a yearlong display. The two shows that begin today are ''Figure as Subject: The Last Decade'' and ''Twentieth Century American Art: Highlights of the Permanent Collection,'' both drawn from the Whitney's permanent collection.

title: A RENT-CONTROL HOLDOUT SHOWING HER GUMPTION
description: Jean Herman walks along the stretch of Lexington Avenue near Bloomingdale's, and as she does, heads turn and people stop her. But it is not her style that attracts them; it is her moxie.

title: Hunters Kill 5 Bison At Yellowstone Border
description: Five hunters shot five bison on the boundary of Yellowstone National Park at dawn today, and state wildlife officials said more hunters would probably be needed to kill 125 more in coming weeks. Three were killed at the end of December.

title: NASA SET ASIDE A 'FAIL-SAFE' RULE FOR BOOSTER SEAL
description: The space agency waived its requirement for effective backup safety seals on the space shuttle's booster rockets three years ago, agency officials acknowledged today.

title: HORMEL REPORTS HIRING COMPLETED AT STRIKEBOUND MINNESOTA PLANT
description: One month after reopening its strikebound plant in Austin, Geo. A. Hormel & Company said today that it had virtually completed hiring and would achieve full operations within three or four weeks.

title: HANNAFORD BROTHERS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HAITIAN EXILES THINK MANY WILL STAY IN U.S.
description: The euphoria that spilled out into the streets of Miami's Little Haiti at the news of the flight of President Jean-Claude Duvalier last week has subsided into an appraisal of the Haitian exile community's chances, or desire, to go home again.

title: U.S. Says Navy Jets Buzzed Libyan Planes
description: United States Navy warplanes intercepted Libyan jets more than a dozen times over the Mediterranean Tuesday night and today, but there was no hostile action, Defense Department officials said.

title: Human Rights Dilemma
description: Shortly before the Geneva summit, a Soviet official visiting here was asked why his Government did not improve the climate by releasing some dissidents. ''We know what happens,'' he answered angrily. ''We get no credit from you for such a gesture. You just tell us we have to do more.''

title: Israeli Protesters Oppose Convention Led by Kahane
description: Thousands of protesters representing a number of peace movements and youth organizations demonstrated outside a Jerusalem auditorium today where the Jewish nationalist Kach Party, headed by Rabbi Meir Kahane, held a convention.

title: THURSDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Knicks vs. Philadelphia 76ers, at Madison Square Garden, 7:30 P.M. The Knicks play at home for the first time since Jan. 28 after a six-game road trip. Philadelphia has won all three of the previous meetings this season. (Television - MSG, 7:30 P.M. Radio - WPAT, 930; 7:30 P.M.) Nets vs. Cleveland Cavaliers, at Richfield, Ohio, 7:30 P.M. The Nets have won two of the three games played against the Cavaliers this season. (Television - SportsChannel, 11 P.M. tape. Radio - WNBC, 660; 7:30 P.M.) Golf Hawaiian Open, opening round, at Honolulu. Mark O'Meara is the defending champion. PGA Seniors Championship, at Palm Beach Gardens, Fla., opening round. Hockey Devils vs. Montreal Canadiens, at East Rutherford, N.J., Byrne Meadowlands Arena, 7:35 P.M. In their only other meetings this season, the Devils were beaten by 7-3 at home and by 8-3 in Montreal.

title: Fall in Bond Yields Continues
description: Yields on long-term Treasury bonds continued to decline yesterday as traders were encouraged by reports of good demand from Japan, while domestic investors were encouraged by declining oil prices.

title: Dropping Names

The winner was Don Mattingly.

title: 3 WEEKS OF LOVE ON THE RUN: INMATES WED BUT GET CAUGHT
description: Their three weeks of love as fugitives were worth any additional time they may have to serve, say a couple who fell in love in prison, married and escaped together.

Underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation are expected to offer the units next week.

title: ACTRESSES' VARIED ROADS TO 'THE COLOR PURPLE'
description: The four strong black women who star in the movie ''The Color Purple'' literally prayed and begged to win their roles after reading Alice Walker's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel. The impact of her story about black women oppressed and then liberated was unusually intense and almost mystical.

title: 'Coffee King' Convicted
description: A Federal jury has convicted Alberto Duque, once known as the ''Boy Coffee King,'' of 60 counts in an $85 million bank fraud case. Mr. Duque, 36 years old, whose coffee holdings once included the Chase & Sanborn Company, faces a total of 288 years in prison and fines of $285,000 on charges of conspiracy, wire fraud and misapplication of the funds of City National Bank, which he controlled.

title: HERS
description: TODAY she's called a card reader, tea reader, palmist - or psychic. She can count corporate executives, statesmen and police departments among her list of clients. And she plies her trade anywhere from the back rooms of storefronts to center stage on the talk-show circuits. Yesterday she was called a witch. And before she was burned at the stake or drowned, she would have undergone torture to force her to admit to a liaison with the Devil. While times have changed, women are still the predominant practitioners of the art of spiritualism. And now that they have areas of specialization, a psychic counselor and a herbal healer may no longer be the same person.

description: RESTRUCTURINGS have become a way of life at the Penn Central Corporation these past few years, and analysts do not expect it to stop now. This is especially true after this week's announcement that the former railroad holding company had settled its differences with the Internal Revenue Service over a disputed portion of the company's enormous tax loss carry-forwards.

title: Behind Moscow's Fear of 'Star Wars'
description: Moscow's fear of President Reagan's Strategic Defense Initiative stems not so much from the strategic component of a nuclear shield but from applications that the research would create for conventional arms. Fear that such research could nullify the Soviet Union's numerical superiority in weapons explains Moscow's willingness to trade from its arsenal to stop the ''Star Wars'' program.

description: Secretary of State George P. Shultz will travel to four European countries next month and wind up in the Vatican on Easter Sunday for an audience with Pope John Paul II, the State Department announced today. Mr. Shultz plans to visit France, Turkey, Greece and Italy and will hold talks with government officials.

description: ''I often dreamed of my arrival in Israel and my reunion with my wife.

title: SHARED MEDICAL SYSTEMS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DESIGNER OUTLETS TRANSFORM A TOWN
description: ONE Friday at high noon, one of Birmingham's wealthiest young sophisticates, who requested anonymity, led a convoy into this tribal hill country in northeastern Alabama, Hatfield-McCoy territory where not long ago a state's attorney was jumped in a county courtroom. The Birminghamian would leave 32 hours later with her bounty: Austrian crystal, Royal Doulton giftware, nine pairs of L. L. Bean pants, a Cuisinart, 120 pairs of Hanes stockings. Why the moderation? Her second truck never arrived, and the Chevy Luv pickup's capacity was only 1.5 tons.

title: Volume Payments
description: A Federal judge has approved a final plan for repaying most of the customers of Volume Investors, a small commodity brokerage firm that failed last March. The money is expected to go out this morning. The plan, approved late Tuesday by Judge Kevin Duffy, will send $6.7 million to about 100 customers, according to the Commodity Exchange, where Volume Investors operated.

description: Dr. Donal M. Billig, defending himself against manslaughter charges in the deaths of five heart patients, said today that the death rate among his patients was not high and denied that fellow doctors had told him he was incompetent to conduct surgery at the Bethesda Naval Hospital.

title: Universal-Rundle
description: The Colorado investor Michael R. Krupp said he had raised his stake in the Universal-Rundle Corporation from 7.3 percent of the company's shares outstanding to 8.5 percent. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Mr. Krupp said he had held discussions with Sears, Roebuck & Company about the acquisition of Sears's controlling interest in Universal ''with the ultimate objective of acquiring all of Universal's shares.'' Sears, which holds 57 percent of Universal's shares outstanding, said it would respond shortly.

title: Transtechnology
description: The Transtechnology Corporation said that it had begun a cash tender offer to buy 1.3 million shares of Lundy Electronics and Systems Inc. common stock for $14 a share.

title: Filipino Bravery Deserves Better
description: To his credit, President Reagan encouraged the brave supporters of Philippine democracy to challenge a tyrant. To his shame, he now professes a fine impartiality about possible violence and fraud on both sides. There is no factual basis for that suggestion and as long as it stands uncorrected, it comforts the tyrant and afflicts the victims.

title: Morial Gives Up Race For New Orleans Council
description: Mayor Ernest N. Dutch Morial dropped his campaign for a seat on the City Council today, ending any prospect of his moving directly to another elected position after he leaves office in two and a half months.

title: Bridge: Expert Entrants in Majority For a New York Pairs Event
description: Tournament players must in general do their own work in finding partners and teammates, although a few lonely souls apply for help to the partnership desk. An annual exception in New York City is the Newcomers/ Life Master Pairs, which provides a headache for the sponsoring body, the Greater New York Bridge Association.

title: Technology; Selling Cars By Computer
description: WHILE the microchip has changed the way automobiles perform, controlling everything from fuel injection to suspension systems, it also promises vast changes in the way cars are sold.

title: LEARNING THE CARE OF STREET TREES
description: Life in New York is competitive, stressful and crowded for many people and it is no less so for trees. Urban gardeners looking to spruce up the shape of their street trees or who would like to plant a new one can learn about it at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden's fifth annual ''Making Brooklyn Bloom'' free program on Sunday, Feb. 23.

title: RECITAL: CHARLES NEIDICH
description: THE Walter W. Naumburg Foundation recently held what was apparently the first major clarinet competition in this country, and Tuesday night it presented the winner, Charles Neidich, in recital at Alice Tully Hall.

title: THE THEATER: 'HALALA!'
description: ''HALALA!,'' which means ''congratulations'' in Zulu, drumbeats its resistance to oppressive authority. This musical collage, written and directed by Welcome Msomi, expresses its faith in all fighters for freedom, saluting the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and Malcolm X as well as Steve Biko and other African martyrs. The show, at the Douglas Fairbanks Theater, makes a point that demands constant reiteration, but, as musical theater, it pays a price for its own ingenuousness.

title: ON 'CURRENTS,' A LOOK AT ECONOMICS OF DIVORCE
description: THE lot of a divorced woman is not a happy one. That is the message of ''A House Divided: The Economics of Divorce,'' tonight's offering of ''Currents,'' on Channel 13 at 8:30 P.M. We are told that despite changes in the divorce laws meant to give the former wife a larger share of the family assets, she still faces a dim future, especially if she has young children to raise or is trying to rejoin the job market at the age of 50 or older.

title: WEINBERGER ASKS POWER TO SHUT 3 BASES FAST
description: Defense Secretary Caspar W. Weinberger challenged Congress today to prove its willingness to save money by authorizing him to shut unneeded military bases with two months' notice.
